field.name: INPUT
field.description: GPIO input bus value, each bit represents a bus bit 0: low level presents on chip pin 1: high level presents on chip pin

field.name: OUTPUT
field.description: GPIO output register value, each bit represents a bus bit 0: chip pin output low level when direction is output 1: chip pin output high level when direction is output

field.name: OUTPUT
field.description: GPIO output register value, each bit represents a bus bit 0: chip pin output low level when direction is output 1: chip pin output high level when direction is output

field.name: OUTPUT
field.description: GPIO output register value, each bit represents a bus bit 0: chip pin output low level when direction is output 1: chip pin output high level when direction is output

field.name: OUTPUT
field.description: GPIO output register value, each bit represents a bus bit 0: chip pin output low level when direction is output 1: chip pin output high level when direction is output

field.name: DIRECTION
field.description: GPIO direction, each bit represents a bus bit 0: input 1: output

field.name: DIRECTION
field.description: GPIO direction, each bit represents a bus bit 0: input 1: output

field.name: DIRECTION
field.description: GPIO direction, each bit represents a bus bit 0: input 1: output

field.name: DIRECTION
field.description: GPIO direction, each bit represents a bus bit 0: input 1: output

field.name: IRQ_FLAG
field.description: GPIO interrupt flag, write 1 to clear this flag 0: no irq 1: irq pending

field.name: IRQ_EN
field.description: GPIO interrupt enable, each bit represents a bus bit 0: irq is disabled 1: irq is enable

field.name: IRQ_EN
field.description: GPIO interrupt enable, each bit represents a bus bit 0: irq is disabled 1: irq is enable

field.name: IRQ_EN
field.description: GPIO interrupt enable, each bit represents a bus bit 0: irq is disabled 1: irq is enable

field.name: IRQ_EN
field.description: GPIO interrupt enable, each bit represents a bus bit 0: irq is disabled 1: irq is enable

field.name: IRQ_POL
field.description: GPIO interrupt polarity, each bit represents a bus bit 0: irq is high level or rising edge 1: irq is low level or falling edge

field.name: IRQ_POL
field.description: GPIO interrupt polarity, each bit represents a bus bit 0: irq is high level or rising edge 1: irq is low level or falling edge

field.name: IRQ_POL
field.description: GPIO interrupt polarity, each bit represents a bus bit 0: irq is high level or rising edge 1: irq is low level or falling edge

field.name: IRQ_POL
field.description: GPIO interrupt polarity, each bit represents a bus bit 0: irq is high level or rising edge 1: irq is low level or falling edge

field.name: IRQ_TYPE
field.description: GPIO interrupt type, each bit represents a bus bit 0: irq is triggered by level 1: irq is triggered by edge

field.name: IRQ_TYPE
field.description: GPIO interrupt type, each bit represents a bus bit 0: irq is triggered by level 1: irq is triggered by edge

field.name: IRQ_TYPE
field.description: GPIO interrupt type, each bit represents a bus bit 0: irq is triggered by level 1: irq is triggered by edge

field.name: IRQ_TYPE
field.description: GPIO interrupt type, each bit represents a bus bit 0: irq is triggered by level 1: irq is triggered by edge

field.name: IRQ_ASYNC
field.description: GPIO interrupt asynchronous, each bit represents a bus bit 0: irq is triggered base on system clock 1: irq is triggered combinational Note: combinational interrupt is sensitive to environment noise

field.name: IRQ_ASYNC
field.description: GPIO interrupt asynchronous, each bit represents a bus bit 0: irq is triggered base on system clock 1: irq is triggered combinational Note: combinational interrupt is sensitive to environment noise

field.name: IRQ_ASYNC
field.description: GPIO interrupt asynchronous, each bit represents a bus bit 0: irq is triggered base on system clock 1: irq is triggered combinational Note: combinational interrupt is sensitive to environment noise

field.name: IRQ_ASYNC
field.description: GPIO interrupt asynchronous, each bit represents a bus bit 0: irq is triggered base on system clock 1: irq is triggered combinational Note: combinational interrupt is sensitive to environment noise

register.name: VALUE
register.description: GPIO dual edge interrupt enable value

field.name: IRQ_DUAL
field.description: GPIO dual edge interrupt enable 0: single edge interrupt 1: dual edge interrupt enable

register.name: SET
register.description: GPIO dual edge interrupt enable set

field.name: IRQ_DUAL
field.description: GPIO dual edge interrupt enable set 0: keep original edge interrupt type 1: dual edge interrupt enable

register.name: CLEAR
register.description: GPIO dual edge interrupt enable clear

field.name: IRQ_DUAL
field.description: GPIO dual edge interrupt enable clear 0: keep original edge interrupt type 1: single edge interrupt enable

register.name: TOGGLE
register.description: GPIO dual edge interrupt enable toggle

field.name: IRQ_DUAL
field.description: GPIO dual edge interrupt enable toggle 0: keep original edge interrupt type 1: change original edge interrupt type to another one.

field.name: VECTORED
field.description: Vector mode enable 0: Disabled 1: Enabled

field.name: PREEMPT
field.description: Preemptive priority interrupt enable 0: Disabled 1: Enabled

field.name: PRIORITY
field.description: Interrupt source priority. The valid range of this field is 0-7. 0: Never interrupt 1-7: Interrupt source priority. The larger the value, the higher the priority.

field.name: INTERRUPT
field.description: The interrupt pending status of inpterrupt sources. Every interrupt source occupies 1 bit.

field.name: INTERRUPT
field.description: The interrupt trigger type of interrupt sources. Every interrupt source occupies 1 bit. 0: Level-triggered interrupt 1: Edge-triggered interrupt

register.name: NUMBER
register.description: Number of supported interrupt sources and targets

field.name: NUM_TARGET
field.description: The number of supported targets

field.name: NUM_INTERRUPT
field.description: The number of supported interrupt sources

field.name: MAX_PRIORITY
field.description: The maximum priority supported

field.name: VERSION
field.description: The version of the PLIC design

field.name: INTERRUPT
field.description: The interrupt enable bit for interrupt. Every interrupt source occupies 1 bit.

field.name: THRESHOLD
field.description: Interrupt priority threshold.

field.name: INTERRUPT_ID
field.description: On reads, indicating the interrupt source that has being claimed. On writes, indicating the interrupt source that has been handled (completed).

field.name: PRIORITY_PREEMPTED
field.description: Each bit indicates if the corresponding priority level has been preempted by a higher-priority interrupt.

field.name: MTIME
field.description: Machine time

field.name: MTIMECMP
field.description: Machine time compare

field.name: INTERRUPT
field.description: writing 1 to trigger software interrupt

field.name: INTERRUPT
field.description: enable software interrupt

field.name: INTERRUPT_ID
field.description: On reads, indicating the interrupt source that has being claimed. On writes, indicating the interrupt source that has been handled (completed).

field.name: CNTUPT
field.description: 1- update counter to new value as CNTUPTVAL This bit will be auto cleared after 1 cycle

field.name: OPMODE
field.description: 0: round mode 1: one-shot mode, timer will stopped at reload point.user need clear CEN and set it to start timer agian. NOTE: reload irq will be always set at one-shot mode at end

field.name: MONITOR_SEL
field.description: set to monitor input signal high level time(chan_meas_high) clr to monitor input signal period(chan_meas_prd)

field.name: MONITOR_EN
field.description: set to monitor input signal period or high level time. When this bit is set, if detected period less than val_0 or more than val_1, will set related irq_sts * only can be used when trig_mode is selected as measure mode(100) * the time may not correct after reload, so monitor is disabled after reload point, and enabled again after two continul posedge. if no posedge after reload for more than val_1, will also assert irq_capt

field.name: CNTRST
field.description: 1- reset counter

field.name: SYNCFLW
field.description: 1- enable this channel to reset counter to reload(RLD) together with its previous channel. This bit is not valid for channel 0.

field.name: SYNCIFEN
field.description: 1- SYNCI is valid on its falling edge

field.name: SYNCIREN
field.description: 1- SYNCI is valid on its rising edge

field.name: CEN
field.description: 1- counter enable

field.name: CMPINIT
field.description: Output compare initial poliarity 1- The channel output initial level is high 0- The channel output initial level is low User should set this bit before set CMPEN to 1.

field.name: CMPEN
field.description: 1- Enable the channel output compare function. The output signal can be generated per comparator (CMPx) settings.

field.name: DMASEL
field.description: select one of DMA request: 00- CMP0 flag 01- CMP1 flag 10- Input signal toggle captured 11- RLD flag, counter reload;

field.name: DMAEN
field.description: 1- enable dma

field.name: SWSYNCIEN
field.description: 1- enable software sync. When this bit is set, counter will reset to RLD when swsynct bit is set

field.name: DBGPAUSE
field.description: 1- counter will pause if chip is in debug mode

field.name: CAPMODE
field.description: This bitfield define the input capture mode 100: width measure mode, timer will calculate the input signal period and duty cycle 011: capture at both rising edge and falling edge 010: capture at falling edge 001: capture at rising edge 000: No capture

field.name: CMP
field.description: compare value 0

field.name: RLD
field.description: reload value

field.name: CNTUPTVAL
field.description: counter will be set to this value when software write cntupt bit in CR

field.name: CAPPOS
field.description: This register contains the counter value captured at input signal rising edge

field.name: CAPNEG
field.description: This register contains the counter value captured at input signal falling edge

field.name: CAPPRD
field.description: This register contains the input signal period when channel is configured to input capture measure mode.

field.name: MEAS_HIGH
field.description: This register contains the input signal duty cycle when channel is configured to input capture measure mode.

field.name: COUNTER
field.description: 32 bit counter value

field.name: CH3CMP1F
field.description: channel 3 compare value 1 match flag

field.name: CH3CMP0F
field.description: channel 3 compare value 1 match flag

field.name: CH3CAPF
field.description: channel 3 capture flag, the flag will be set at the valid capture edge per CAPMODE setting. If the capture channel is set to measure mode, the flag will be set at rising edge.

field.name: CH3RLDF
field.description: channel 3 counter reload flag

field.name: CH2CMP1F
field.description: channel 2 compare value 1 match flag

field.name: CH2CMP0F
field.description: channel 2 compare value 1 match flag

field.name: CH2CAPF
field.description: channel 2 capture flag, the flag will be set at the valid capture edge per CAPMODE setting. If the capture channel is set to measure mode, the flag will be set at rising edge.

field.name: CH2RLDF
field.description: channel 2 counter reload flag

field.name: CH1CMP1F
field.description: channel 1 compare value 1 match flag

field.name: CH1CMP0F
field.description: channel 1 compare value 1 match flag

field.name: CH1CAPF
field.description: channel 1 capture flag, the flag will be set at the valid capture edge per CAPMODE setting. If the capture channel is set to measure mode, the flag will be set at rising edge.

field.name: CH1RLDF
field.description: channel 1 counter reload flag

field.name: CH0CMP1F
field.description: channel 1 compare value 1 match flag

field.name: CH0CMP0F
field.description: channel 1 compare value 1 match flag

field.name: CH0CAPF
field.description: channel 1 capture flag, the flag will be set at the valid capture edge per CAPMODE setting. If the capture channel is set to measure mode, the flag will be set at rising edge.

field.name: CH0RLDF
field.description: channel 1 counter reload flag

field.name: CH3CMP1EN
field.description: 1- generate interrupt request when ch3cmp1f flag is set

field.name: CH3CMP0EN
field.description: 1- generate interrupt request when ch3cmp0f flag is set

field.name: CH3CAPEN
field.description: 1- generate interrupt request when ch3capf flag is set

field.name: CH3RLDEN
field.description: 1- generate interrupt request when ch3rldf flag is set

field.name: CH2CMP1EN
field.description: 1- generate interrupt request when ch2cmp1f flag is set

field.name: CH2CMP0EN
field.description: 1- generate interrupt request when ch2cmp0f flag is set

field.name: CH2CAPEN
field.description: 1- generate interrupt request when ch2capf flag is set

field.name: CH2RLDEN
field.description: 1- generate interrupt request when ch2rldf flag is set

field.name: CH1CMP1EN
field.description: 1- generate interrupt request when ch1cmp1f flag is set

field.name: CH1CMP0EN
field.description: 1- generate interrupt request when ch1cmp0f flag is set

field.name: CH1CAPEN
field.description: 1- generate interrupt request when ch1capf flag is set

field.name: CH1RLDEN
field.description: 1- generate interrupt request when ch1rldf flag is set

field.name: CH0CMP1EN
field.description: 1- generate interrupt request when ch0cmp1f flag is set

field.name: CH0CMP0EN
field.description: 1- generate interrupt request when ch0cmp0f flag is set

field.name: CH0CAPEN
field.description: 1- generate interrupt request when ch0capf flag is set

field.name: CH0RLDEN
field.description: 1- generate interrupt request when ch0rldf flag is set

field.name: SWSYNCT
field.description: set this bitfield to trigger software counter sync event

field.name: TX_IDLE_COND
field.description: IDLE Detection Condition 0 - Treat as idle if TX pin is logic one 1 - Treat as idle if UART state machine state is idle

field.name: TX_IDLE_EN
field.description: UART TX Idle Detect Enable 0 - Disable 1 - Enable

field.name: TX_IDLE_THR
field.description: Threshold for UART transmit Idle detection (in terms of bits)

field.name: RXEN
field.description: UART receive enable. 0 - hold RX input to high, avoide wrong data input when config pinmux 1 - bypass RX input from PIN software should set it after config pinmux

field.name: RX_IDLE_COND
field.description: IDLE Detection Condition 0 - Treat as idle if RX pin is logic one 1 - Treat as idle if UART state machine state is idle

field.name: RX_IDLE_EN
field.description: UART Idle Detect Enable 0 - Disable 1 - Enable it should be enabled if enable address match feature

field.name: RX_IDLE_THR
field.description: Threshold for UART Receive Idle detection (in terms of bits)

field.name: TXEN_9BIT
field.description: set to use 9bit mode for transmitter, will set the MSB for the first character as address flag, keep 0 for others.

field.name: RXEN_ADDR_MSB
field.description: set to use MSB as address flag at receiver(actually this is done by software set correct MSB in addr0/addr1). Clr to use first character as address. Only needed if enable address match feature

field.name: RXEN_9BIT
field.description: set to use 9bit mode for receiver, only valid if rxen_addr_msb is set

field.name: A1_EN
field.description: enable addr1 compare for the first character. If a1_en OR a0_en, then do not receive data if address not match. If ~a1_en AND ~a0_en, the receive all data like before. NOTE: should set idle_tmout_en if enable address match feature

field.name: A0_EN
field.description: enable addr0 compare for the first character

field.name: ADDR1
field.description: address 1 fileld. in 9bit mode, this is the full address byte. For other mode(8/7/6/5bit), MSB should be set for address flag. If want address==0 to be matched at 8bit mode, should set addr1=0x80

field.name: ADDR0
field.description: address 0 field.

field.name: RXIDLE_FLAG
field.description: UART RX IDLE Flag, assert after rxd high and then rx idle timeout, write one clear 0 - UART RX is busy 1 - UART RX is idle

field.name: TXIDLE_FLAG
field.description: UART TX IDLE Flag, assert after txd high and then tx idle timeout, write one clear 0 - UART TX is busy 1 - UART TX is idle

field.name: ADDR_MATCH
field.description: address match irq status, assert if either address match(and enabled). Write one clear NOTE: the address byte may not moved by DMA at this point. User can wait next addr_match_idle irq for the whole data include address

field.name: ADDR_MATCH_IDLE
field.description: address match and idle irq status, assert at rx bus idle if address match event triggered. Write one clear;

field.name: DATA_LOST
field.description: assert if data lost before address match status, write one clear; It will not assert if no address match occurs

field.name: FIFOED
field.description: FIFOs enabled These two bits are 1 when bit 0 of the FIFO Control Register (FIFOE) is set to 1.

field.name: INTRID
field.description: Interrupt ID, see IIR2 for detail decoding

field.name: FIFOSIZE
field.description: The depth of RXFIFO and TXFIFO 0: 16-byte FIFO 1: 32-byte FIFO 2: 64-byte FIFO 3: 128-byte FIFO

field.name: OSC
field.description: Over-sample control The value must be an even number; any odd value writes to this field will be converted to an even value. OSC=0: reserved OSC<=8: The over-sample ratio is 8 8 < OSC< 32: The over sample ratio is OSC

field.name: FIFOT4EN
field.description: set to use new 4bit fifo threshold(TFIFOT4 and RFIFOT4) clr to use 2bit(TFIFOT and RFIFOT)

field.name: TFIFOT4
field.description: txfifo threshold(0 for 1byte, 0xF for 16bytes), uart will send tx_dma_req when data in fifo is less than threshold.

field.name: RFIFOT4
field.description: rxfifo threshold(0 for 1byte, 0xF for 16bytes). Uart will send rx_dma_req if data in fifo reachs the threshold, also will set the rxdata irq if enabled

field.name: RFIFOT
field.description: Receiver FIFO trigger level

field.name: TFIFOT
field.description: Transmitter FIFO trigger level

field.name: DMAE
field.description: DMA enable 0: Disable 1: Enable

field.name: TFIFORST
field.description: Transmitter FIFO reset Write 1 to clear all bytes in the TXFIFO and resets its counter. The Transmitter Shift Register is not cleared. This bit will automatically be cleared.

field.name: RFIFORST
field.description: Receiver FIFO reset Write 1 to clear all bytes in the RXFIFO and resets its counter. The Receiver Shift Register is not cleared. This bit will automatically be cleared.

field.name: FIFOE
field.description: FIFO enable Write 1 to enable both the transmitter and receiver FIFOs. The FIFOs are reset when the value of this bit toggles.

field.name: SWTRG
field.description: software trigger. User should avoid use sw/hw trigger at same time, otherwise result unknown. Hardware auto reset.

field.name: TXSTP_BITS
field.description: if TXSTOP_INSERT is enabled, the STOP bits to be inserted between each byte. 0 for 1 bit; 0xFF for 256bits

field.name: HWTRG_EN
field.description: set to enable hardware trigger(trigger from moto is shared by other UART)

field.name: TRG_MODE
field.description: set to enable trigger mode. software should push needed data into txbuffer frist, uart will not start transmission at this time. User should send trigger signal(by hw or sw), uart will send all data in txfifo till empty NOTE: the hw_trigger should be pulse signal from trig mux.

field.name: TRG_CLR_RFIFO
field.description: set to enable the feature that, clear rxfifo at tx trigger(sw or hw), avoid unexpected data in rxfifo.

field.name: TXSTOP_INSERT
field.description: set to insert STOP bits between each tx byte till tx fifo empty. NOTE: there will be no 1.5/2 STOP bits if enabled this feature, LCR.STB should be set to 0 if this bit is set

field.name: RBR
field.description: Receive data read port

field.name: THR
field.description: Transmit data write port

field.name: DLL
field.description: Least significant byte of the Divisor Latch

field.name: ERXIDLE
field.description: Enable Receive Idle interrupt 0 - Disable Idle interrupt 1 - Enable Idle interrupt

field.name: ETXIDLE
field.description: enable transmit idle interrupt

field.name: EADDRM
field.description: enable ADDR_MATCH interrupt

field.name: EADDRM_IDLE
field.description: enable ADDR_MATCH_IDLE interrupt

field.name: EDATLOST
field.description: enable DATA_LOST interrupt

field.name: EMSI
field.description: Enable modem status interrupt The interrupt asserts when the status of one of the following occurs: The status of modem_rin, modem_dcdn, modem_dsrn or modem_ctsn (If the auto-cts mode is disabled) has been changed. If the auto-cts mode is enabled (MCR bit4 (AFE) = 1), modem_ctsn would be used to control the transmitter.

field.name: ELSI
field.description: Enable receiver line status interrupt

field.name: ETHEI
field.description: Enable transmitter holding register interrupt

field.name: ERBI
field.description: Enable received data available interrupt and the character timeout interrupt 0: Disable 1: Enable

field.name: DLM
field.description: Most significant byte of the Divisor Latch

field.name: RXIDLE_FLAG
field.description: UART IDLE Flag 0 - UART is busy 1 - UART is idle NOTE: when write one to clear this bit, avoid changging FCR register since it's same address as IIR

field.name: FIFOED
field.description: FIFOs enabled These two bits are 1 when bit 0 of the FIFO Control Register (FIFOE) is set to 1.

field.name: INTRID
field.description: Interrupt ID, see IIR2 for detail decoding

field.name: RFIFOT
field.description: Receiver FIFO trigger level

field.name: TFIFOT
field.description: Transmitter FIFO trigger level

field.name: DMAE
field.description: DMA enable 0: Disable 1: Enable

field.name: TFIFORST
field.description: Transmitter FIFO reset Write 1 to clear all bytes in the TXFIFO and resets its counter. The Transmitter Shift Register is not cleared. This bit will automatically be cleared.

field.name: RFIFORST
field.description: Receiver FIFO reset Write 1 to clear all bytes in the RXFIFO and resets its counter. The Receiver Shift Register is not cleared. This bit will automatically be cleared.

field.name: FIFOE
field.description: FIFO enable Write 1 to enable both the transmitter and receiver FIFOs. The FIFOs are reset when the value of this bit toggles.

field.name: DLAB
field.description: Divisor latch access bit

field.name: BC
field.description: Break control

field.name: SPS
field.description: Stick parity 1: Parity bit is constant 0 or 1, depending on bit4 (EPS). 0: Disable the sticky bit parity.

field.name: EPS
field.description: Even parity select 1: Even parity (an even number of logic-1 is in the data and parity bits) 0: Old parity.

field.name: PEN
field.description: Parity enable When this bit is set, a parity bit is generated in transmitted data before the first STOP bit and the parity bit would be checked for the received data.

field.name: STB
field.description: Number of STOP bits 0: 1 bits 1: The number of STOP bit is based on the WLS setting When WLS = 0, STOP bit is 1.5 bits When WLS = 1, 2, 3, STOP bit is 2 bits

field.name: WLS
field.description: Word length setting 0: 5 bits 1: 6 bits 2: 7 bits 3: 8 bits

field.name: AFE
field.description: Auto flow control enable 0: Disable 1: The auto-CTS and auto-RTS setting is based on the RTS bit setting: When RTS = 0, auto-CTS only When RTS = 1, auto-CTS and auto-RTS

field.name: LOOP
field.description: Enable loopback mode 0: Disable 1: Enable

field.name: RTS
field.description: Request to send This bit controls the modem_rtsn output. 0: The modem_rtsn output signal will be driven HIGH 1: The modem_rtsn output signal will be driven LOW

field.name: RXIDLE
field.description: rxidle after timeout, clear after rx idle condition not match

field.name: TXIDLE
field.description: txidle after timeout, clear after tx idle condition not match

field.name: RFIFO_NUM
field.description: data bytes in rxfifo not read

field.name: TFIFO_NUM
field.description: data bytes in txfifo not sent

field.name: ERRF
field.description: Error in RXFIFO In the FIFO mode, this bit is set when there is at least one parity error, framing error, or line break associated with data in the RXFIFO. It is cleared when this register is read and there is no more error for the rest of data in the RXFIFO.

field.name: TEMT
field.description: Transmitter empty This bit is 1 when the THR (TXFIFO in the FIFO mode) and the Transmitter Shift Register (TSR) are both empty. Otherwise, it is zero.

field.name: THRE
field.description: Transmitter Holding Register empty This bit is 1 when the THR (TXFIFO in the FIFO mode) is empty. Otherwise, it is zero. If the THRE interrupt is enabled, an interrupt is triggered when THRE becomes 1.

field.name: LBREAK
field.description: Line break This bit is set when the uart_sin input signal was held LOWfor longer than the time for a full-word transmission. A full-word transmission is the transmission of the START, data, parity, and STOP bits. It is cleared when this register is read. In the FIFO mode, this bit indicates the line break for the received data at the top of the RXFIFO.

field.name: FE
field.description: Framing error This bit is set when the received STOP bit is not HIGH. It is cleared when this register is read. In the FIFO mode, this bit indicates the framing error for the received data at the top of the RXFIFO.

field.name: PE
field.description: Parity error This bit is set when the received parity does not match with the parity selected in the LCR[5:4]. It is cleared when this register is read. In the FIFO mode, this bit indicates the parity error for the received data at the top of the RXFIFO.

field.name: OE
field.description: Overrun error This bit indicates that data in the Receiver Buffer Register (RBR) is overrun.

field.name: DR
field.description: Data ready. This bit is set when there are incoming received data in the Receiver Buffer Register (RBR). It is cleared when all of the received data are read.

field.name: CTS
field.description: Clear to send 0: The modem_ctsn input signal is HIGH. 1: The modem_ctsn input signal is LOW.

field.name: DCTS
field.description: Delta clear to send This bit is set when the state of the modem_ctsn input signal has been changed since the last time this register is read.

field.name: DATA
field.description: A one-byte storage register

field.name: FIFOSIZE
field.description: FIFO Size: 0: 2 bytes 1: 4 bytes 2: 8 bytes 3: 16 bytes

field.name: CMPL
field.description: Set to enable the Completion Interrupt. Master: interrupts when a transaction is issued from this master and completed without losing the bus arbitration. Slave: interrupts when a transaction addressing the controller is completed.

field.name: BYTERECV
field.description: Set to enable the Byte Receive Interrupt. Interrupts when a byte of data is received Auto-ACK will be disabled if this interrupt is enabled, that is, the software needs to ACK/NACK the received byte manually.

field.name: BYTETRANS
field.description: Set to enable the Byte Transmit Interrupt. Interrupts when a byte of data is transmitted.

field.name: START
field.description: Set to enable the START Condition Interrupt. Interrupts when a START condition/repeated START condition is detected.

field.name: STOP
field.description: Set to enable the STOP Condition Interrupt Interrupts when a STOP condition is detected.

field.name: ARBLOSE
field.description: Set to enable the Arbitration Lose Interrupt. Master: interrupts when the controller loses the bus arbitration Slave: not available in this mode.

field.name: ADDRHIT
field.description: Set to enable the Address Hit Interrupt. Master: interrupts when the addressed slave returned an ACK. Slave: interrupts when the controller is addressed.

field.name: FIFOHALF
field.description: Set to enable the FIFO Half Interrupt. Receiver: Interrupts when the FIFO is half-empty, i.e, there is >= 1/2 entries in the FIFO. Transmitter: Interrupts when the FIFO is half-empty, i.e. there is <= 1/2 entries in the FIFO. This interrupt depends on the transaction direction; don’t enable this interrupt unless the transfer direction is determined, otherwise unintended interrupts may be triggered.

field.name: FIFOFULL
field.description: Set to enable the FIFO Full Interrupt. Interrupts when the FIFO is full.

field.name: FIFOEMPTY
field.description: Set to enabled the FIFO Empty Interrupt Interrupts when the FIFO is empty.

field.name: LINESDA
field.description: Indicates the current status of the SDA line on the bus 1: high 0: low

field.name: LINESCL
field.description: Indicates the current status of the SCL line on the bus 1: high 0: low

field.name: GENCALL
field.description: Indicates that the address of the current transaction is a general call address: 1: General call 0: Not general call

field.name: BUSBUSY
field.description: Indicates that the bus is busy The bus is busy when a START condition is on bus and it ends when a STOP condition is seen on bus 1: Busy 0: Not busy

field.name: ACK
field.description: Indicates the type of the last received/transmitted acknowledgement bit: 1: ACK 0: NACK

field.name: CMPL
field.description: Transaction Completion Master: Indicates that a transaction has been issued from this master and completed without losing the bus arbitration Slave: Indicates that a transaction addressing the controller has been completed. This status bit must be cleared to receive the next transaction; otherwise, the next incoming transaction will be blocked.

field.name: BYTERECV
field.description: Indicates that a byte of data has been received.

field.name: BYTETRANS
field.description: Indicates that a byte of data has been transmitted.

field.name: START
field.description: Indicates that a START Condition or a repeated START condition has been transmitted/received.

field.name: STOP
field.description: Indicates that a STOP Condition has been transmitted/received.

field.name: ARBLOSE
field.description: Indicates that the controller has lost the bus arbitration.

field.name: ADDRHIT
field.description: Master: indicates that a slave has responded to the transaction. Slave: indicates that a transaction is targeting the controller (including the General Call).

field.name: FIFOHALF
field.description: Transmitter: Indicates that the FIFO is half-empty.

field.name: FIFOFULL
field.description: Indicates that the FIFO is full.

field.name: FIFOEMPTY
field.description: Indicates that the FIFO is empty.

field.name: ADDR
field.description: The slave address. For 7-bit addressing mode, the most significant 3 bits are ignored and only the least-significant 7 bits of Addr are valid

field.name: DATA
field.description: Write this register to put one byte of data to the FIFO. Read this register to get one byte of data from the FIFO.

field.name: DATACNT_HIGH
field.description: Data counts in bytes. Master: The number of bytes to transmit/receive. 0 means max length. DataCnt will be decreased by one for each byte transmitted/received. Slave: the meaning of DataCnt depends on the DMA mode: If DMA is not enabled, DataCnt is the number of bytes transmitted/received from the bus master. It is reset to 0 when the controller is addressed and then increased by one for each byte of data transmitted/received. If DMA is enabled, DataCnt is the number of bytes to transmit/receive. It will not be reset to 0 when the slave is addressed and it will be decreased by one for each byte of data transmitted/received.

field.name: RESET_LEN
field.description: reset clock cycles. the clock high/low time is defined by Setup.T_SCLHi, 50% duty cycle.

field.name: RESET_HOLD_SCKIN
field.description: set to hold input clock to high when reset is active

field.name: RESET_ON
field.description: set to send reset signals(just toggle clock bus defined by reset_len). this register is clered when reset is end, can't be cleared by software

field.name: PHASE_START
field.description: Enable this bit to send a START condition at the beginning of transaction. Master mode only.

field.name: PHASE_ADDR
field.description: Enable this bit to send the address after START condition. Master mode only.

field.name: PHASE_DATA
field.description: Enable this bit to send the data after Address phase. Master mode only.

field.name: PHASE_STOP
field.description: Enable this bit to send a STOP condition at the end of a transaction. Master mode only.

field.name: DIR
field.description: Transaction direction Master: Set this bit to determine the direction for the next transaction. 0: Transmitter 1: Receiver Slave: The direction of the last received transaction. 0: Receiver 1: Transmitter

field.name: DATACNT
field.description: Data counts in bytes. Master: The number of bytes to transmit/receive. 0 means max length. DataCnt will be decreased by one for each byte transmitted/received. Slave: the meaning of DataCnt depends on the DMA mode: If DMA is not enabled, DataCnt is the number of bytes transmitted/received from the bus master. It is reset to 0 when the controller is addressed and then increased by one for each byte of data transmitted/received. If DMA is enabled, DataCnt is the number of bytes to transmit/receive. It will not be reset to 0 when the slave is addressed and it will be decreased by one for each byte of data transmitted/received.

field.name: CMD
field.description: Write this register with the following values to perform the corresponding actions: 0x0: no action 0x1: issue a data transaction (Master only) 0x2: respond with an ACK to the received byte 0x3: respond with a NACK to the received byte 0x4: clear the FIFO 0x5: reset the I2C controller (abort current transaction, set the SDA and SCL line to the open-drain mode, reset the Status Register and the Interrupt Enable Register, and empty the FIFO) When issuing a data transaction by writing 0x1 to this register, the CMD field stays at 0x1 for the duration of the entire transaction, and it is only cleared to 0x0 after when the transaction has completed or when the controller loses the arbitration. Note: No transaction will be issued by the controller when all phases (Start, Address, Data and Stop) are disabled.

field.name: T_SUDAT
field.description: T_SUDAT defines the data setup time before releasing the SCL. Setup time = (2 * tpclk) + (2 + T_SP + T_SUDAT) * tpclk* (TPM+1) tpclk = PCLK period TPM = The multiplier value in Timing Parameter Multiplier Register

field.name: T_SP
field.description: T_SP defines the pulse width of spikes that must be suppressed by the input filter. Pulse width = T_SP * tpclk* (TPM+1)

field.name: T_HDDAT
field.description: T_HDDAT defines the data hold time after SCL goes LOW Hold time = (2 * tpclk) + (2 + T_SP + T_HDDAT) * tpclk* (TPM+1)

field.name: T_SCLRADIO
field.description: The LOW period of the generated SCL clock is defined by the combination of T_SCLRatio and T_SCLHi values. When T_SCLRatio = 0, the LOW period is equal to HIGH period. When T_SCLRatio = 1, the LOW period is roughly two times of HIGH period. SCL LOW period = (2 * tpclk) + (2 + T_SP + T_SCLHi * ratio) * tpclk * (TPM+1) 1: ratio = 2 0: ratio = 1 This field is only valid when the controller is in the master mode.

field.name: T_SCLHI
field.description: The HIGH period of generated SCL clock is defined by T_SCLHi. SCL HIGH period = (2 * tpclk) + (2 + T_SP + T_SCLHi) * tpclk* (TPM+1) The T_SCLHi value must be greater than T_SP and T_HDDAT values. This field is only valid when the controller is in the master mode.

field.name: DMAEN
field.description: Enable the direct memory access mode data transfer. 1: Enable 0: Disable

field.name: MASTER
field.description: Configure this device as a master or a slave. 1: Master mode 0: Slave mode

field.name: ADDRESSING
field.description: I2C addressing mode: 1: 10-bit addressing mode 0: 7-bit addressing mode

field.name: IICEN
field.description: Enable the I2C controller. 1: Enable 0: Disable

field.name: TPM
field.description: A multiplication value for I2C timing parameters. All the timing parameters in the Setup Register are multiplied by (TPM+1).

field.name: WRTRANCNT
field.description: Transfer count for write data WrTranCnt indicates the number of units of data to be transmitted to the SPI bus from the Data Register. The actual transfer count is (WrTranCnt+1). WrTranCnt only takes effect when TransMode is 0, 1, 3, 4, 5, 6 or 8. The size (bit-width) of a data unit is defined by the DataLen field of the Transfer Format Register. For TransMode 0, WrTranCnt must be equal to RdTranCnt.

field.name: RDTRANCNT
field.description: Transfer count for read data RdTranCnt indicates the number of units of data to be received from SPI bus and stored to the Data Register. The actual received count is (RdTranCnt+1). RdTransCnt only takes effect when TransMode is 0, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 or 9. The size (bit-width) of a data unit is defined by the DataLen field of the Transfer Format Register. For TransMode 0, WrTranCnt must equal RdTranCnt.

field.name: ADDRLEN
field.description: Address length in bytes 0x0: 1 byte 0x1: 2 bytes 0x2: 3 bytes 0x3: 4 bytes

field.name: DATALEN
field.description: The length of each data unit in bits The actual bit number of a data unit is (DataLen + 1)

field.name: DATAMERGE
field.description: Enable Data Merge mode, which does automatic data split on write and data coalescing on read. This bit only takes effect when DataLen = 0x7. Under Data Merge mode, each write to the Data Register will transmit all fourbytes of the write data; each read from the Data Register will retrieve four bytes of received data as a single word data. When Data Merge mode is disabled, only the least (DataLen+1) significient bits of the Data Register are valid for read/write operations; no automatic data split/coalescing will be performed.

field.name: MOSIBIDIR
field.description: Bi-directional MOSI in regular (single) mode 0x0: MOSI is uni-directional signal in regular mode. 0x1: MOSI is bi-directional signal in regular mode. This bi-directional signal replaces the two

field.name: LSB
field.description: Transfer data with the least significant bit first 0x0: Most significant bit first 0x1: Least significant bit first

field.name: SLVMODE
field.description: SPI Master/Slave mode selection 0x0: Master mode 0x1: Slave mode

field.name: CPOL
field.description: SPI Clock Polarity 0x0: SCLK is LOW in the idle states 0x1: SCLK is HIGH in the idle states

field.name: CPHA
field.description: SPI Clock Phase 0x0: Sampling data at odd SCLK edges 0x1: Sampling data at even SCLK edges

field.name: DIRECTIOEN
field.description: Enable Direct IO 0x0: Disable 0x1: Enable

field.name: HOLD_OE
field.description: Output enable for the SPI Flash hold signal

field.name: WP_OE
field.description: Output enable for the SPI Flash write protect signal

field.name: MISO_OE
field.description: Output enable fo the SPI MISO signal

field.name: MOSI_OE
field.description: Output enable for the SPI MOSI signal

field.name: SCLK_OE
field.description: Output enable for the SPI SCLK signal

field.name: CS_OE
field.description: Output enable for SPI CS (chip select) signal

field.name: HOLD_O
field.description: Output value for the SPI Flash hold signal

field.name: WP_O
field.description: Output value for the SPI Flash write protect signal

field.name: MISO_O
field.description: Output value for the SPI MISO signal

field.name: MOSI_O
field.description: Output value for the SPI MOSI signal

field.name: SCLK_O
field.description: Output value for the SPI SCLK signal

field.name: CS_O
field.description: Output value for the SPI CS (chip select) signal

field.name: HOLD_I
field.description: Status of the SPI Flash hold signal

field.name: WP_I
field.description: Status of the SPI Flash write protect signal

field.name: MISO_I
field.description: Status of the SPI MISO signal

field.name: MOSI_I
field.description: Status of the SPI MOSI signal

field.name: SCLK_I
field.description: Status of the SPI SCLK signal

field.name: CS_I
field.description: Status of the SPI CS (chip select) signal

field.name: SLVDATAONLY
field.description: Data-only mode (slave mode only) 0x0: Disable the data-only mode 0x1: Enable the data-only mode Note: This mode only works in the uni-directional regular (single) mode so MOSIBiDir, DualQuad and TransMode should be set to 0.

field.name: CMDEN
field.description: SPI command phase enable (Master mode only) 0x0: Disable the command phase 0x1: Enable the command phase

field.name: ADDREN
field.description: SPI address phase enable (Master mode only) 0x0: Disable the address phase 0x1: Enable the address phase

field.name: ADDRFMT
field.description: SPI address phase format (Master mode only) 0x0: Address phase is the regular (single) mode 0x1: The format of the address phase is the same as the data phase (DualQuad).

field.name: TRANSMODE
field.description: Transfer mode The transfer sequence could be 0x0: Write and read at the same time 0x1: Write only 0x2: Read only 0x3: Write, Read 0x4: Read, Write 0x5: Write, Dummy, Read 0x6: Read, Dummy, Write 0x7: None Data (must enable CmdEn or AddrEn in master mode) 0x8: Dummy, Write 0x9: Dummy, Read 0xa~0xf: Reserved

field.name: DUALQUAD
field.description: SPI data phase format 0x0: Regular (Single) mode 0x1: Dual I/O mode 0x2: Quad I/O mode 0x3: Reserved

field.name: TOKENEN
field.description: Token transfer enable (Master mode only) Append a one-byte special token following the address phase for SPI read transfers. The value of the special token should be selected in TokenValue. 0x0: Disable the one-byte special token 0x1: Enable the one-byte special token

field.name: WRTRANCNT
field.description: Transfer count for write data WrTranCnt indicates the number of units of data to be transmitted to the SPI bus from the Data Register. The actual transfer count is (WrTranCnt+1). WrTranCnt only takes effect when TransMode is 0, 1, 3, 4, 5, 6 or 8. The size (bit-width) of a data unit is defined by the DataLen field of the Transfer Format Register. For TransMode 0, WrTranCnt must be equal to RdTranCnt.

field.name: TOKENVALUE
field.description: Token value (Master mode only) The value of the one-byte special token following the address phase for SPI read transfers. 0x0: token value = 0x00 0x1: token value = 0x69

field.name: DUMMYCNT
field.description: Dummy data count. The actual dummy count is (DummyCnt +1). The number of dummy cycles on the SPI interface will be (DummyCnt+1)* ((DataLen+1)/SPI IO width) The Data pins are put into the high impedance during the dummy data phase. DummyCnt is only used for TransMode 5, 6, 8 and 9, which has dummy data phases.

field.name: RDTRANCNT
field.description: Transfer count for read data RdTranCnt indicates the number of units of data to be received from SPI bus and stored to the Data Register. The actual received count is (RdTranCnt+1). RdTransCnt only takes effect when TransMode is 0, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 or 9. The size (bit-width) of a data unit is defined by the DataLen field of the Transfer Format Register. For TransMode 0, WrTranCnt must equal RdTranCnt.

field.name: CMD
field.description: SPI Command

field.name: ADDR
field.description: SPI Address (Master mode only)

field.name: DATA
field.description: Data to transmit or the received data For writes, data is enqueued to the TX FIFO. The least significant byte is always transmitted first. If the TX FIFO is full and the SPIActive bit of the status register is 1, the ready signal hready/pready will be deasserted to insert wait states to the transfer. For reads, data is read and dequeued from the RX FIFO. The least significant byte is the first received byte. If the RX FIFO is empty and the SPIActive bit of the status register is 1, the ready signal hready/pready will be deasserted to insert wait states to the transfer. The FIFOs decouple the speed of the SPI transfers and the software鈥檚 generation/consumption of data. When the TX FIFO is empty, SPI transfers will hold until more data is written to the TX FIFO; when the RX FIFO is full, SPI transfers will hold until there is more room in the RX FIFO. If more data is written to the TX FIFO than the write transfer count (WrTranCnt), the remaining data will stay in the TX FIFO for the next transfer or until the TX FIFO is reset.

field.name: CS_EN
field.description: No description available

field.name: TXTHRES
field.description: Transmit (TX) FIFO Threshold The TXFIFOInt interrupt or DMA request would be issued to replenish the TX FIFO when the TX data count is less than or equal to the TX FIFO threshold.

field.name: RXTHRES
field.description: Receive (RX) FIFO Threshold The RXFIFOInt interrupt or DMA request would be issued for consuming the RX FIFO when the RX data count is more than or equal to the RX FIFO threshold.

field.name: TXDMAEN
field.description: TX DMA enable

field.name: RXDMAEN
field.description: RX DMA enable

field.name: TXFIFORST
field.description: Transmit FIFO reset Write 1 to reset. It is automatically cleared to 0 after the reset operation completes.

field.name: RXFIFORST
field.description: Receive FIFO reset Write 1 to reset. It is automatically cleared to 0 after the reset operation completes.

field.name: SPIRST
field.description: SPI reset Write 1 to reset. It is automatically cleared to 0 after the reset operation completes.

field.name: TXNUM_7_6
field.description: Number of valid entries in the Transmit FIFO

field.name: RXNUM_7_6
field.description: Number of valid entries in the Receive FIFO

field.name: TXFULL
field.description: Transmit FIFO Full flag

field.name: TXEMPTY
field.description: Transmit FIFO Empty flag

field.name: TXNUM_5_0
field.description: Number of valid entries in the Transmit FIFO

field.name: RXFULL
field.description: Receive FIFO Full flag

field.name: RXEMPTY
field.description: Receive FIFO Empty flag

field.name: RXNUM_5_0
field.description: Number of valid entries in the Receive FIFO

field.name: SPIACTIVE
field.description: SPI register programming is in progress. In master mode, SPIActive becomes 1 after the SPI command register is written and becomes 0 after the transfer is finished. In slave mode, SPIActive becomes 1 after the SPI CS signal is asserted and becomes 0 after the SPI CS signal is deasserted. Note that due to clock synchronization, it may take at most two spi_clock cycles for SPIActive to change when the corresponding condition happens. Note this bit stays 0 when Direct IO Control or the memory-mapped interface is used.

field.name: SLVCMDEN
field.description: Enable the Slave Command Interrupt. Control whether interrupts are triggered whenever slave commands are received. (Slave mode only)

field.name: ENDINTEN
field.description: Enable the End of SPI Transfer interrupt. Control whether interrupts are triggered when SPI transfers end. (In slave mode, end of read status transaction doesn鈥檛 trigger this interrupt.)

field.name: TXFIFOINTEN
field.description: Enable the SPI Transmit FIFO Threshold interrupt. Control whether interrupts are triggered when the valid entries are less than or equal to the TX FIFO threshold.

field.name: RXFIFOINTEN
field.description: Enable the SPI Receive FIFO Threshold interrupt. Control whether interrupts are triggered when the valid entries are greater than or equal to the RX FIFO threshold.

field.name: TXFIFOURINTEN
field.description: Enable the SPI Transmit FIFO Underrun interrupt. Control whether interrupts are triggered when the Transmit FIFO run out of data. (Slave mode only)

field.name: RXFIFOORINTEN
field.description: Enable the SPI Receive FIFO Overrun interrupt. Control whether interrupts are triggered when the Receive FIFO overflows. (Slave mode only)

field.name: SLVCMDINT
field.description: Slave Command Interrupt. This bit is set when Slave Command interrupts occur. (Slave mode only)

field.name: ENDINT
field.description: End of SPI Transfer interrupt. This bit is set when End of SPI Transfer interrupts occur.

field.name: TXFIFOINT
field.description: TX FIFO Threshold interrupt. This bit is set when TX FIFO Threshold interrupts occur.

field.name: RXFIFOINT
field.description: RX FIFO Threshold interrupt. This bit is set when RX FIFO Threshold interrupts occur.

field.name: TXFIFOURINT
field.description: TX FIFO Underrun interrupt. This bit is set when TX FIFO Underrun interrupts occur. (Slave mode only)

field.name: RXFIFOORINT
field.description: RX FIFO Overrun interrupt. This bit is set when RX FIFO Overrun interrupts occur. (Slave mode only)

field.name: CS2SCLK
field.description: The minimum time between the edges of SPI CS and the edges of SCLK. SCLK_period * (CS2SCLK + 1) / 2

field.name: CSHT
field.description: The minimum time that SPI CS should stay HIGH. SCLK_period * (CSHT + 1) / 2

field.name: SCLK_DIV
field.description: The clock frequency ratio between the clock source and SPI interface SCLK. SCLK_period = ((SCLK_DIV + 1) * 2) * (Period of the SPI clock source) The SCLK_DIV value 0xff is a special value which indicates that the SCLK frequency should be the same as the spi_clock frequency.

field.name: UNDERRUN
field.description: Data underrun occurs in the last transaction

field.name: OVERRUN
field.description: Data overrun occurs in the last transaction

field.name: READY
field.description: Set this bit to indicate that the ATCSPI200 is ready for data transaction. When an SPI transaction other than slave status-reading command ends, this bit will be cleared to 0.

field.name: USR_STATUS
field.description: User defined status flags

field.name: WCNT
field.description: Slave transmitted data count

field.name: RCNT
field.description: Slave received data count

field.name: VAL
field.description: No description available

field.name: VAL
field.description: No description available

field.name: SLAVE
field.description: Support for SPI Slave mode

field.name: QUADSPI
field.description: Support for Quad I/O SPI

field.name: DUALSPI
field.description: Support for Dual I/O SPI

field.name: TXFIFOSIZE
field.description: Depth of TX FIFO 0x0: 2 words 0x1: 4 words 0x2: 8 words 0x3: 16 words 0x4: 32 words 0x5: 64 words 0x6: 128 words

field.name: RXFIFOSIZE
field.description: Depth of RX FIFO 0x0: 2 words 0x1: 4 words 0x2: 8 words 0x3: 16 words 0x4: 32 words 0x5: 64 words 0x6: 128 words

field.name: PRE_SET
field.description: 0: no pre set 1: CRC32 2: CRC32-AUTOSAR 3: CRC16-CCITT 4: CRC16-XMODEM 5: CRC16-MODBUS 1: CRC32 2: CRC32-autosar 3: CRC16-ccitt 4: CRC16-xmodem 5: CRC16-modbus 6: crc16_dnp 7: crc16_x25 8: crc16_usb 9: crc16_maxim 10: crc16_ibm 11: crc8_maxim 12: crc8_rohc 13: crc8_itu 14: crc8 15: crc5_usb

register.name: clr
register.description: chn&index0 clear crc result and setting

field.name: CLR
field.description: write 1 to clr crc setting and result for its channel. always read 0.

field.name: POLY
field.description: poly setting

field.name: INIT_DATA
field.description: initial data of CRC

field.name: XOROUT
field.description: XOR for CRC result

field.name: BYTE_REV
field.description: 0: no wrap input byte order 1: wrap input byte order

field.name: REV_OUT
field.description: 0: no wrap output bit order 1: wrap output bit order

field.name: REV_IN
field.description: 0: no wrap input bit order 1: wrap input bit order

field.name: POLY_WIDTH
field.description: crc data length

field.name: DATA
field.description: data for crc

field.name: RESULT
field.description: crc result

field.name: T
field.description: Signed number of temperature in 256 x celsius degree

field.name: T
field.description: maximum temperature ever found

field.name: T
field.description: minimum temperature ever found

field.name: AGE
field.description: age of T register in 24MHz clock cycles

field.name: VALID
field.description: indicate value in T is valid or not 0: not valid 1:valid

field.name: TRIGGER
field.description: Software trigger for sensing in trigger mode, trigger will be ignored if in sensing or other mode

field.name: IRQ_EN
field.description: Enable interrupt

field.name: RST_EN
field.description: Enable reset

field.name: COMPARE_MIN_EN
field.description: Enable compare for minimum temperature

field.name: COMPARE_MAX_EN
field.description: Enable compare for maximum temperature

field.name: SPEED
field.description: cycles of a progressive step in 24M clock, valid from 24-255, default 96 24: 24 cycle for a step 25: 25 cycle for a step 26: 26 cycle for a step ... 255: 255 cycle for a step

field.name: AVERAGE
field.description: Average time, default in 3 0: measure and return 1: twice and average 2: 4 times and average . . . 7: 128 times and average

field.name: CONTINUOUS
field.description: continuous mode that keep sampling temperature peridically 0: trigger mode 1: continuous mode

field.name: ASYNC
field.description: Acynchronous mode, this mode can work without clock, only available function ios compare to certain ADC value 0: active mode 1: Async mode

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: Enable temperature 0: disable, temperature sensor is shut down 1: enable. Temperature sensor enabled

field.name: VALIDITY
field.description: time for temperature values to expire in 24M clock cycles

field.name: RECORD_MIN_CLR
field.description: Clear minimum recorder of temerature, write 1 to clear

field.name: RECORD_MAX_CLR
field.description: Clear maximum recorder of temerature, write 1 to clear

field.name: UNDER_TEMP
field.description: Clear under temperature status, write 1 to clear

field.name: OVER_TEMP
field.description: Clear over temperature status, write 1 to clear

field.name: IRQ
field.description: IRQ flag, write 1 to clear

field.name: T
field.description: Maximum temperature for compare

field.name: T
field.description: Minimum temperature for compare

field.name: T
field.description: Maximum temperature for compare

field.name: T
field.description: Minimum temperature for compare

field.name: ASYNC_TYPE
field.description: Compare hotter than or colder than in asynchoronous mode 0: hotter than 1: colder than

field.name: POLARITY
field.description: Polarity of internal comparator

field.name: VALUE
field.description: Value of async mode to compare

field.name: ASYNC_IRQ
field.description: interrupt status of asynchronous mode

field.name: ACTIVE_IRQ
field.description: interrupt status of active mode

field.name: SAMPLING
field.description: temperature sampling is working

field.name: NEG_ONLY
field.description: use negative compare polarity only

field.name: POS_ONLY
field.description: use positive compare polarity only

field.name: TXRESET
field.description: Reset TX Fifo and word.

field.name: BARCTL
field.description: Bus Access Response Control, when bit 15:14= 00: no bus error will be generated, no wait for fifo write when fifo full and no wait for word/fifo read when word message invalid or fifo empty; or when write to word/fifo message will be ignored. 01: bus error will be generated when: 1, access invalid address; 2, write to ready only addr; 3, write to fulled fifo or valid message; 4, read from a emptied fifo/word message. 10: no error will be generated, but bus will wait when 1, write to fulled fifo/reg message; 2, read from a emptied fifo/reg message; write to word message will overwrite the existing reg value enven word message are still valid; read from invalid word message will read out last read out message data.happen. 11: reserved.

field.name: BEIE
field.description: Bus Error Interrupt Enable, will enable the interrupt for any bus error as described in the SR bit 13 to bit 8. 1, enable the bus access error interrupt. 0, disable the bus access error interrupt.

field.name: TFMAIE
field.description: TX FIFO message available interrupt enable. 1, enable the TX FIFO massage available interrupt. 0, disable the TX FIFO message available interrupt.

field.name: TFMEIE
field.description: TX FIFO message empty interrupt enable. 1, enable the TX FIFO massage empty interrupt. 0, disable the TX FIFO message empty interrupt.

field.name: RFMAIE
field.description: RX FIFO message available interrupt enable. 1, enable the RX FIFO massage available interrupt. 0, disable the RX FIFO message available interrupt.

field.name: RFMFIE
field.description: RX fifo message full interrupt enable. 1, enable the RX fifo message full interrupt. 0, disable the RX fifo message full interrupt.

field.name: TWMEIE
field.description: TX word message empty interrupt enable. 1, enable the TX word massage empty interrupt. 0, disable the TX word message empty interrupt.

field.name: RWMVIE
field.description: RX word message valid interrupt enable. 1, enable the RX word massage valid interrupt. 0, disable the RX word message valid interrupt.

field.name: RFVC
field.description: RX FIFO valid message count

field.name: TFEC
field.description: TX FIFO empty message word count

field.name: ERRRE
field.description: bus Error for read when rx word message are still invalid, this bit is W1C bit. 1, read from word message when the word message are still invalid will cause this error bit set. 0, nothis kind of bus error; write this bit to 1 will clear this bit when this kind of error happen.

field.name: EWTRF
field.description: bus Error for write when tx word message are still valid, this bit is W1C bit. 1, write to word message when the word message are still valid will cause this error bit set. 0, nothis kind of bus error; write this bit to 1 will clear this bit when this kind of error happen.

field.name: ERRFE
field.description: bus Error for read when rx fifo empty, this bit is W1C bit. 1, read from a empty rx fifo will cause this error bit set. 0, nothis kind of bus error; write this bit to 1 will clear this bit when this kind of error happen.

field.name: EWTFF
field.description: bus Error for write when tx fifo full, this bit is W1C bit. 1, write to a fulled tx fifo will cause this error bit set. 0, nothis kind of bus error; write this bit to 1 will clear this bit when this kind of error happen.

field.name: EAIVA
field.description: bus Error for Accessing Invalid Address; this bit is W1C bit. 1, read and write to invalid address in the bus of this block, will set this bit. 0, nothis kind of bus error; write this bit to 1 will clear this bit when this kind of error happen.

field.name: EW2RO
field.description: bus Error for Write to Read Only address; this bit is W1C bit. 1, write to read only address happened in the bus of this block. 0, nothis kind of bus error; write this bit to 1 will clear this bit when this kind of error happen.

field.name: TFMA
field.description: TX FIFO Message slot available, the 4x32 TX FIFO message buffer to the other core full, will not trigger any interrupt. 1, TXFIFO message buffer has slot available 0, no slot available (fifo full)

field.name: TFME
field.description: TX FIFO Message Empty, no any data in the message FIFO buffer from other core, will not trigger any interrupt.message from other core. 1, no any message data in TXFIFO from other core. 0, there are some data in the 4x32 TX FIFO from other core yet.

field.name: RFMA
field.description: RX FIFO Message Available, available data in the 4x32 TX FIFO message buffer to the other core, will trigger interrupt if the related interrupt enable bit set in the control (CR) registrer. 1, no any data in the 4x32 TXFIFO message buffer. 0, there are some data in the the 4x32 TXFIFO message buffer already.

field.name: RFMF
field.description: RX FIFO Message Full, message from other core; will trigger interrupt if the related interrupt enable bit set in the control (CR) registrer. 1, the other core had written 4x32 message in the RXFIFO. 0, no 4x32 RX FIFO message from other core yet.

field.name: TWME
field.description: TX word message empty, will trigger interrupt if the related interrupt enable bit set in the control (CR) registrer. 1, means this core had write word message to TXREG. 0, means no valid word message in the TXREG yet.

field.name: RWMV
field.description: RX word message valid, will trigger interrupt if the related interrupt enable bit set in the control (CR) registrer. 1, the other core had written word message in the RXREG. 0, no valid word message yet in the RXREG.

register.name: TXREG
register.description: Transmit word message to other core.

field.name: TXREG
field.description: Transmit word message to other core.

register.name: RXREG
register.description: Receive word message from other core.

field.name: RXREG
field.description: Receive word message from other core.

field.name: TXFIFO
RXFIFO

register.name: CTRL0
register.description: wdog ctrl register 0 Note: Parity check is required once writing to this register. The result should be zero by modular two addition of all bits

field.name: CLK_SEL
field.description: clock select 0：bus clock 1：ext clock

field.name: DIV_VALUE
field.description: clock divider, the clock divider works as 2 ^ div_value for wdt counter

field.name: WIN_EN
field.description: window mode enable

field.name: WIN_LOWER
field.description: Once window mode is opened, the lower counter value to refresh wdt 00: 4/8 overtime value 01: 5/8 of overtime value 10: 6/8 of overtime value 11: 7/8 of overtime value

field.name: CFG_LOCK
field.description: The register is locked and unlock is needed before re-config registers Once the lock mechanism takes effect, the CTRL0, CTRL1, timeout int register, timeout rst register, needs unlock before re-config them. The register update needs to be finished in the required period defined by UPD_OT_TIME register

field.name: OT_SELF_CLEAR
field.description: overtime reset can be self released after 32 function cycles

field.name: REF_OT_REQ
field.description: If refresh event has to be limited into a period after refresh unlocked. Note: the refresh overtime counter works in bus clock domain, not in wdt function clock domain. The wdt divider doesn't take effect for refresh counter

field.name: WIN_UPPER
field.description: The upper threshold of window value The window period upper limit is: lower_limit + (overtime_rst_value / 16) * upper_reg_value If this register value is zero, then no upper level limitation

field.name: REF_LOCK
field.description: WDT refresh has to be unlocked firstly once refresh lock is enable.

field.name: REF_UNLOCK_MEC
field.description: Unlock refresh mechanism 00: the required unlock password is the same with refresh_psd_register 01: the required unlock password is a ring shift left value of refresh_psd_register 10: the required unlock password is always 16'h55AA, no matter what refresh_psd_register is 11: the required unlock password is a LSFR result of refresh_psd_register, the characteristic polynomial is X^15 + 1

field.name: EN_DBG
field.description: WTD enable or not in debug mode

field.name: EN_LP
field.description: WDT enable or not in low power mode 2'b00: wdt is halted once in low power mode 2'b01: wdt will work with 1/4 normal clock freq in low power mode 2'b10: wdt will work with 1/2 normal clock freq in low power mode 2'b11: wdt will work with normal clock freq in low power mode

register.name: CTRL1
register.description: wdog ctrl register 1 Note: Parity check is required once writing to this register. The result should be zero by modular two addition of all bits

field.name: REF_FAIL_RST_EN
field.description: Refresh violation will trigger an reset. These event will be taken as a refresh violation: 1) Not refresh in the window once window mode is enabled 2) Not unlock refresh firstly if unlock is required 3) Not refresh in the required time after unlock, once refresh unlock overtime is enabled. 4) Not write the required word to refresh wdt.

field.name: REF_FAIL_INT_EN
field.description: Refresh violation will trigger an interrupt

field.name: UNL_REF_FAIL_RST_EN
field.description: Refresh unlock fail will trigger a reset

field.name: UNL_REF_FAIL_INT_EN
field.description: Refresh unlock fail will trigger a interrupt

field.name: OT_RST_EN
field.description: WDT overtime will generate a reset

field.name: OT_INT_EN
field.description: WDT can generate an interrupt warning before timeout

field.name: CTL_VIO_RST_EN
field.description: Ctrl update violation will trigger a reset The violation event is to try updating the locked register before unlock them

field.name: CTL_VIO_INT_EN
field.description: Ctrl update violation will trigger a interrupt

field.name: UNL_CTL_FAIL_RST_EN
field.description: Unlock register update failure will trigger a reset

field.name: UNL_CTL_FAIL_INT_EN
field.description: Unlock register update failure will trigger a interrupt

field.name: PARITY_FAIL_RST_EN
field.description: Parity error will trigger a reset A parity check is required once writing to ctrl0 and ctrl1 register. The result should be zero by modular two addition of all bits

field.name: PARITY_FAIL_INT_EN
field.description: Parity error will trigger a interrupt

field.name: OT_INT_VAL
field.description: WDT timeout interrupt value

field.name: OT_RST_VAL
field.description: WDT timeout reset value

field.name: WDT_REFRESH_REG
field.description: Write this register by 32'h5A45_524F to refresh wdog Note: Reading this register can read back wdt real time counter value, while it is only used by debug purpose

field.name: PARITY_ERROR
field.description: parity error Write one to clear the bit

field.name: OT_RST
field.description: Timeout happens, a reset will happen once enable bit set This bit can be cleared only by refreshing wdt or reset

field.name: OT_INT
field.description: Timeout happens, a interrupt will happen once enable bit set This bit can be cleared only by refreshing wdt or reset

field.name: CTL_UNL_FAIL
field.description: Unlock ctrl reg update protection fail Write one to clear the bit

field.name: CTL_VIO
field.description: Violate register update protection mechanism Write one to clear the bit

field.name: REF_UNL_FAIL
field.description: Refresh unlock fail Write one to clear the bit

field.name: REF_VIO
field.description: Refresh fail Write one to clear the bit

field.name: UPD_OT_TIME
field.description: The period in which register update has to be in after unlock The required period is less than： 128 * 2 ^ UPD_OT_TIME * bus_clock_cycle

field.name: UPD_PSD
field.description: The password of unlocking register update

field.name: REF_UNL_PSD
field.description: The password to unlock refreshing

field.name: WDOG_EN
field.description: Wdog is enabled, the re-written of this register is impacted by enable lock function

field.name: REFRESH_PERIOD
field.description: The refresh period after refresh unlocked Note: the refresh overtime counter works in bus clock domain, not in wdt function clock domain. The wdt divider doesn't take effect for refresh counter

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: DMA Mux Channel Enable Enables the channel for DMA Mux. The DMA has separate channel enables/disables, which should be used to disable or reconfigure a DMA channel. 0b - DMA Mux channel is disabled 1b - DMA Mux channel is enabled

field.name: SOURCE
field.description: DMA Channel Source Specifies which DMA source, if any, is routed to a particular DMA channel. See the "DMA MUX Mapping"

field.name: DMASTATE
CURCHAN
field.description: current channel in used

field.name: CHAINXFR
field.description: Chain transfer 0x0: Chain transfer is not configured 0x1: Chain transfer is configured

field.name: REQSYNC
field.description: DMA request synchronization. The DMA request synchronization should be configured to avoid signal integrity problems when the request signal is not clocked by the system bus clock, which the DMA control logic operates in. If the request synchronization is not configured, the request signal is sampled directly without synchronization. 0x0: Request synchronization is not configured 0x1: Request synchronization is configured

field.name: DATAWIDTH
field.description: AXI bus data width 0x0: 32 bits 0x1: 64 bits 0x2: 128 bits 0x3: 256 bits

field.name: ADDRWIDTH
field.description: AXI bus address width 0x18: 24 bits 0x19: 25 bits ... 0x40: 64 bits Others: Invalid

field.name: CORENUM
field.description: DMA core number 0x0: 1 core 0x1: 2 cores

field.name: BUSNUM
field.description: AXI bus interface number 0x0: 1 AXI bus 0x1: 2 AXI busses

field.name: REQNUM
field.description: Request/acknowledge pair number 0x0: 0 pair 0x1: 1 pair 0x2: 2 pairs ... 0x10: 16 pairs

field.name: FIFODEPTH
field.description: FIFO depth 0x4: 4 entries 0x8: 8 entries 0x10: 16 entries 0x20: 32 entries Others: Invalid

field.name: CHANNELNUM
field.description: Channel number 0x1: 1 channel 0x2: 2 channels ... 0x8: 8 channels Others: Invalid

field.name: RESET
field.description: Software reset control. Write 1 to this bit to reset the DMA core and disable all channels. Note: The software reset may cause the in-completion of AXI transaction.

field.name: CHABORT
field.description: Write 1 to bit n to abort channel n. The bits should only be set when the corresponding channels are enabled. Otherwise, the writes will be ignored for channels that are not enabled. (N: Number of channels)

field.name: STS
field.description: half transfer done irq status

field.name: STS
field.description: The terminal count status, one bit per channel. The terminal count status is set when a channel transfer finishes without the abort or error event. 0x0: Channel n has no terminal count status 0x1: Channel n has terminal count status

field.name: STS
field.description: The abort status of channel, one bit per channel. The abort status is set when a channel transfer is aborted. 0x0: Channel n has no abort status 0x1: Channel n has abort status

field.name: STS
field.description: The error status, one bit per channel. The error status is set when a channel transfer encounters the following error events: - Bus error - Unaligned address - Unaligned transfer width - Reserved configuration 0x0: Channel n has no error status 0x1: Channel n has error status

field.name: CHEN
field.description: Alias of the Enable field of all ChnCtrl registers

field.name: INFINITELOOP
field.description: set to loop current config infinitely

field.name: HANDSHAKEOPT
field.description: 0: one request to transfer one burst 1: one request to transfer all the data defined in ch_tts

field.name: PRIORITY
field.description: Channel priority level 0x0: Lower priority 0x1: Higher priority

field.name: BURSTOPT
field.description: set to change burst_size definition

field.name: SRCBURSTSIZE
field.description: Source burst size. This field indicates the number of transfers before DMA channel re-arbitration. The burst transfer byte number is (SrcBurstSize * SrcWidth). 0x0: 1 transfer 0x1: 2 transfers 0x2: 4 transfers 0x3: 8 transfers 0x4: 16 transfers 0x5: 32 transfers 0x6: 64 transfers 0x7: 128 transfers 0x8: 256 transfers 0x9:512 transfers 0xa: 1024 transfers 0xb - 0xf: Reserved, setting this field with a reserved value triggers the error exception

field.name: SRCWIDTH
field.description: Source transfer width 0x0: Byte transfer 0x1: Half-word transfer 0x2: Word transfer 0x3: Double word transfer 0x4: Quad word transfer 0x5: Eight word transfer 0x6 - 0x7: Reserved, setting this field with a reserved value triggers the error exception

field.name: DSTWIDTH
field.description: Destination transfer width. Both the total transfer byte number and the burst transfer byte number should be aligned to the destination transfer width; otherwise the error event will be triggered. For example, destination transfer width should be set as byte transfer if total transfer byte is not aligned to half-word. See field SrcBurstSize above for the definition of burst transfer byte number and section 3.2.8 for the definition of the total transfer byte number. 0x0: Byte transfer 0x1: Half-word transfer 0x2: Word transfer 0x3: Double word transfer 0x4: Quad word transfer 0x5: Eight word transfer 0x6 - 0x7: Reserved, setting this field with a reserved value triggers the error exception

field.name: SRCMODE
field.description: Source DMA handshake mode 0x0: Normal mode 0x1: Handshake mode Normal mode is enabled and started by software set Enable bit; Handshake mode is enabled by software set Enable bit, started by hardware dma request from DMAMUX block

field.name: DSTMODE
field.description: Destination DMA handshake mode 0x0: Normal mode 0x1: Handshake mode the difference bewteen Source/Destination handshake mode is: the dma block will response hardware request after read in Source handshake mode; the dma block will response hardware request after write in Destination handshake mode; NOTE: can't set SrcMode and DstMode at same time, otherwise result unknown.

field.name: SRCADDRCTRL
field.description: Source address control 0x0: Increment address 0x1: Decrement address 0x2: Fixed address 0x3: Reserved, setting the field with this value triggers the error exception

field.name: DSTADDRCTRL
field.description: Destination address control 0x0: Increment address 0x1: Decrement address 0x2: Fixed address 0x3: Reserved, setting the field with this value triggers the error exception

field.name: INTHALFCNTMASK
field.description: Channel half interrupt mask 0x0: Allow the half interrupt to be triggered 0x1: Disable the half interrupt

field.name: INTABTMASK
field.description: Channel abort interrupt mask 0x0: Allow the abort interrupt to be triggered 0x1: Disable the abort interrupt

field.name: INTERRMASK
field.description: Channel error interrupt mask 0x0: Allow the error interrupt to be triggered 0x1: Disable the error interrupt

field.name: INTTCMASK
field.description: Channel terminal count interrupt mask 0x0: Allow the terminal count interrupt to be triggered 0x1: Disable the terminal count interrupt

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: Channel enable bit 0x0: Disable 0x1: Enable

field.name: TRANSIZE
field.description: Total transfer size from source. The total number of transferred bytes is (TranSize * SrcWidth). This register is cleared when the DMA transfer is done. If a channel is enabled with zero total transfer size, the error event will be triggered and the transfer will be terminated.

register.name: SrcAddr
register.description: Channel &index0 Source Address Low Part Register

field.name: SRCADDRL
field.description: Low part of the source starting address. When the transfer completes, the value of {SrcAddrH,SrcAddrL} is updated to the ending address. This address must be aligned to the source transfer size; otherwise, an error event will be triggered.

field.name: SRCREQSEL
field.description: Source DMA request select. Select the request/ack handshake pair that the source device is connected to.

field.name: DSTREQSEL
field.description: Destination DMA request select. Select the request/ack handshake pair that the destination device is connected to.

register.name: DstAddr
register.description: Channel &index0 Destination Address Low Part Register

field.name: DSTADDRL
field.description: Low part of the destination starting address. When the transfer completes, the value of {DstAddrH,DstAddrL} is updated to the ending address. This address must be aligned to the destination transfer size; otherwise the error event will be triggered.

register.name: LLPointer
register.description: Channel &index0 Linked List Pointer Low Part Register

field.name: LLPOINTERL
field.description: Low part of the pointer to the next descriptor. The pointer must be double word aligned.

field.name: LOCK
field.description: lock fields in this register, lock can only be cleared by soc reset 0: fields can be changed 1: fields locked to current value, not changeable

field.name: HIDE
field.description: pin value visibility to gpios, bit0: 1, invisible to soc gpio0; 0: visible to soc gpio0 bit2: 1, invisible to cpu0 fast gpio; 0: visible to cpu0 fast gpio

field.name: SELECT
EVT
field.description: Endianness Test Value The endianness test value is 0x87654321.

register.name: DBTP
register.description: data bit timing and prescaler, writeable when CCCR.CCE and CCCR.INT are set

field.name: TDC
field.description: transmitter delay compensation enable 0= Transmitter Delay Compensation disabled 1= Transmitter Delay Compensation enabled

field.name: DBRP
field.description: Data Bit Rate Prescaler The value by which the oscillator frequency is divided for generating the bit time quanta. The bit time is built up from a multiple of this quanta. Valid values for the Bit Rate Prescaler are 0 to 31. When TDC = ‘1’, the range is limited to 0,1. The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the value programmed here is used.

field.name: DTSEG1
field.description: Data time segment before sample point Valid values are 0 to 31. The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the programmed value is used.

field.name: DTSEG2
field.description: Data time segment after sample point Valid values are 0 to 15. The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the programmed value is used.

field.name: DSJW
field.description: Data (Re)Synchronization Jump Width Valid values are 0 to 15. The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the value programmed here is used.

field.name: SVAL
field.description: Started Valid 0= Value of TXBNS not valid 1= Value of TXBNS valid

field.name: TXBNS
field.description: Tx Buffer Number Started Tx Buffer number of message whose transmission was started last. Valid when SVAL is set. Valid values are 0 to 31.

field.name: PVAL
field.description: Prepared Valid 0= Value of TXBNP not valid 1= Value of TXBNP valid

field.name: TXBNP
field.description: Tx Buffer Number Prepared Tx Buffer number of message that is ready for transmission. Valid when PVAL is set.Valid values are 0 to 31.

field.name: RX
field.description: Receive Pin Monitors the actual value of pin m_can_rx 0= The CAN bus is dominant (m_can_rx = ‘0’) 1= The CAN bus is recessive (m_can_rx = ‘1’)

field.name: TX
field.description: Control of Transmit Pin 00 Reset value, m_can_tx controlled by the CAN Core, updated at the end of the CAN bit time 01 Sample Point can be monitored at pin m_can_tx 10 Dominant (‘0’) level at pin m_can_tx 11 Recessive (‘1’) at pin m_can_tx

field.name: LBCK
field.description: Loop Back Mode 0= Reset value, Loop Back Mode is disabled 1= Loop Back Mode is enabled

field.name: WDV
field.description: Watchdog Value Actual Message RAM Watchdog Counter Value.

field.name: WDC
field.description: Watchdog Configuration Start value of the Message RAM Watchdog Counter. With the reset value of “00” the counter is disabled.

field.name: NISO
field.description: Non ISO Operation If this bit is set, the M_CAN uses the CAN FD frame format as specified by the Bosch CAN FD Specification V1.0. 0= CAN FD frame format according to ISO 11898-1:2015 1= CAN FD frame format according to Bosch CAN FD Specification V1.0 Note: When the generic parameter iso_only_g is set to ‘1’ in hardware synthesis, this bit becomes reserved and is read as ‘0’. The M_CAN always operates with the CAN FD frame format according to ISO 11898-1:2015.

field.name: TXP
field.description: Transmit Pause If this bit is set, the M_CAN pauses for two CAN bit times before starting the next transmission after itself has successfully transmitted a frame (see Section 3.5). 0= Transmit pause disabled 1= Transmit pause enabled

field.name: EFBI
field.description: Edge Filtering during Bus Integration 0= Edge filtering disabled 1= Two consecutive dominant tq required to detect an edge for hard synchronization

field.name: PXHD
