field.name: SFTRST
field.description: soft reset. Write 1 then 0, to reset the SDP block.

field.name: CLKGAT
field.description: Clock Gate for the SDP main logic. Write to 1 will clock gate for most logic of the SDP block, dynamic power saving when not use SDP block.

field.name: CIPDIS
field.description: Cipher Disable, read the info, whether the CIPHER features is besing disable in this chip or not. 1, Cipher is disabled in this chip. 0, Cipher is enabled in this chip.

field.name: HASDIS
field.description: HASH Disable, read the info, whether the HASH features is besing disable in this chip or not. 1, HASH is disabled in this chip. 0, HASH is enabled in this chip.

field.name: CIPHEN
field.description: Cipher Enablement, controlled by SW. 1, Cipher is Enabled. 0, Cipher is Disabled.

field.name: HASHEN
field.description: HASH Enablement, controlled by SW. 1, HASH is Enabled. 0, HASH is Disabled.

field.name: MCPEN
field.description: Memory Copy Enablement, controlled by SW. 1, Memory copy is Enabled. 0, Memory copy is Disabled.

field.name: CONFEN
field.description: Constant Fill to memory, controlled by SW. 1, Constant fill is Enabled. 0, Constant fill is Disabled.

field.name: DCRPDI
field.description: Decryption Disable bit, Write to 1 to disable the decryption.

field.name: TSTPKT0IRQ
field.description: Test purpose for interrupt when Packet counter reachs "0", but CHAIN=1 in the current packet.

field.name: RDSCEN
field.description: when set to "1", the 1st data packet descriptor loacted in the register(CMDPTR, NPKTPTR, ...) when set to "0", the 1st data packet descriptor loacted in the memeory(pointed by CMDPTR)

field.name: INTEN
field.description: Interrupt Enablement, controlled by SW. 1, SDP interrupt is enabled. 0, SDP interrupt is disabled.

field.name: AESALG
AESMOD
AESKS
field.description: AES Key Selection. These regisgers are being used to select the AES key that stored in the 16x128 key ram of the SDP, or select the key from the OTP. Detail as following: 0x00: key from the 16x128, this is the key read address, valid for AES128; AES256 will use 128 bit from this address and 128 bit key from next address as 256 bit AES key. 0x01: key from the 16x128, this is the key read address, valid for AES128, not valid for AES286. .... 0x0E: key from the 16x128, this is the key read address, valid for AES128; AES256 will use 128 from this add and 128 from next add for the AES key. 0x0F: key from the 16x128, this is the key read address, valid for AES128, not valid for AES286. 0x20: kman_sk0[127:0] from the key manager for AES128; AES256 will use kman_sk0[255:0] as AES key. 0x21: kman_sk0[255:128] from the key manager for AES128; not valid for AES256. 0x22: kman_sk1[127:0] from the key manager for AES128; AES256 will use kman_sk1[255:0] as AES key. 0x23: kman_sk1[255:128] from the key manager for AES128; not valid for AES256. 0x24: kman_sk2[127:0] from the key manager for AES128; AES256 will use kman_sk2[255:0] as AES key. 0x25: kman_sk2[255:128] from the key manager for AES128; not valid for AES256. 0x26: kman_sk3[127:0] from the key manager for AES128; AES256 will use kman_sk3[255:0] as AES key. 0x27: kman_sk3[255:128] from the key manager for AES128; not valid for AES256. 0x30: exip0_key[127:0] from OTP for AES128; AES256 will use exip0_key[255:0] as AES key. 0x31: exip0_key[255:128] from OTP for AES128; not valid for AES256. 0x32: exip1_key[127:0] from OTP for AES128; AES256 will use exip1_key[255:0] as AES key. 0x33: exip1_key[255:128] from OTP for AES128; not valid for AES256. Other values, reserved.

field.name: AESDIR
field.description: AES direction 1x1, AES Decryption 1x0, AES Encryption.

field.name: HASALG
field.description: HASH Algorithem selection. 0x0 SHA1 — 0x1 CRC32 — 0x2 SHA256 —

field.name: HASCHK
field.description: HASH Check Enable Bit. 1x1, HASH check need, hash result will compare with the HASHRSLT 0-7 registers; 1x0, HASH check is not enabled, HASHRSLT0-7 store the HASH result. For SHA1, will use HASHRSLT0-3 words, and HASH 256 will use HASH0-7 words.

field.name: HASOUT
field.description: When hashing is enabled, this bit controls the input or output data of the AES engine is hashed. 0 INPUT HASH 1 OUTPUT HASH

field.name: DINSWP
field.description: Decide whether the SDP byteswaps the input data (big-endian data); When all bits are set, the data is assumed to be in the big-endian format

field.name: DOUTSWP
field.description: Decide whether the SDP byteswaps the output data (big-endian data); When all bits are set, the data is assumed to be in the big-endian format

field.name: KEYSWP
field.description: Decide whether the SDP byteswaps the Key (big-endian data). When all bits are set, the data is assumed to be in the big-endian format

field.name: CNTVAL
field.description: This read-only field shows the current (instantaneous) value of the packet counter

field.name: CNTINCR
field.description: The value written to this field is added to the spacket count.

field.name: TAG
field.description: packet tag.

field.name: IRQ
field.description: interrupt Request, requested when error happen, or when packet processing done, packet counter reach to zero.

field.name: CHN1PKT0
field.description: the chain buffer "chain" bit is "1", while packet counter is "0", now, waiting for new buffer data.

field.name: AESBSY
field.description: AES Busy

field.name: HASBSY
field.description: Hashing Busy

field.name: PKTCNT0
field.description: Packet Counter registers reachs to ZERO now.

field.name: PKTDON
field.description: Packet processing done, will trigger this itnerrrupt when the "PKTINT" bit set in the packet control word.

field.name: ERRSET
field.description: Working mode setup error.

field.name: ERRPKT
field.description: Packet head access error, or status update error.

field.name: ERRSRC
field.description: Source Buffer Access Error

field.name: ERRDST
field.description: Destination Buffer Error

field.name: ERRHAS
field.description: Hashing Check Error

field.name: ERRCHAIN
field.description: buffer chain error happen when packet's CHAIN bit=0, but the Packet counter is still not zero.

field.name: INDEX
field.description: To write a key to the SDP KEY RAM, the software must first write the desired key index/subword to this register. Key index pointer. The valid indices are 0-[number_keys]. In the SDP, there is a 16x128 key ram can store 16 AES128 keys or 8 AES 256 Keys; this index is for addressing the 16 128-bit key addresses.

field.name: SUBWRD
field.description: Key subword pointer. The valid indices are 0-3. After each write to the key data register, this field increments; To write a key, the software must first write the desired key index/subword to this register.

field.name: KEYDAT
field.description: This register provides the write access to the key/key subword specified by the key index register. Writing this location updates the selected subword for the key located at the index specified by the key index register. The write also triggers the SUBWORD field of the KEY register to increment to the next higher word in the key

field.name: CIPHIV
field.description: cipher initialization vector.

field.name: HASWRD
field.description: Hash Data Word x - HASH result bit; will store the expected hash result bit if hash check enabled; when hash check is not enabled, the hash engine will store the final hash result[31:0] here. If CRC mode enabled, this work store the CRC expected result if the check enabled, or store the final calcuated CRC result.

field.name: CMDPTR
field.description: current command addresses the register points to the multiword descriptor that is to be executed (or is currently being executed)

field.name: NPKTPTR
field.description: Next Packet Address Pointer

field.name: PKTTAG
field.description: packet tag

field.name: CIPHIV
field.description: Load Initial Vector for the AES in this packet.

field.name: HASFNL
field.description: Hash Termination packet

field.name: HASINI
field.description: Hash Initialization packat

field.name: CHAIN
field.description: whether the next command pointer register must be loaded into the channel's current descriptor pointer.

field.name: DCRSEMA
field.description: whether the channel's semaphore must be decremented at the end of the current operation. When the semaphore reaches a value of zero, no more operations are issued from the channel.

field.name: PKTINT
field.description: Reflects whether the channel must issue an interrupt upon the completion of the packet

field.name: PKTSRC
field.description: Packet Memory Source Address

field.name: PKTDST
field.description: Packet Memory Destination Address

field.name: PKTBUF
field.description: No description available

field.name: ALLOW_NSC
field.description: Non-secure state allow 0: system is not healthy to enter non-secure state, request to enter non-secure state will cause a fail state 1: system is healthy to enter non-secure state

field.name: ALLOW_SEC
field.description: Secure state allow 0: system is not healthy to enter secure state, request to enter non-secure state will cause a fail state 1: system is healthy to enter secure state

field.name: PMIC_FAIL
field.description: PMIC secure state one hot indicator 0: secure state is not in fail state 1: secure state is in fail state

field.name: PMIC_NSC
field.description: PMIC secure state one hot indicator 0: secure state is not in non-secure state 1: secure state is in non-secure state

field.name: PMIC_SEC
field.description: PMIC secure state one hot indicator 0: secure state is not in secure state 1: secure state is in secure state

field.name: PMIC_INS
field.description: PMIC secure state one hot indicator 0: secure state is not in inspect state 1: secure state is in inspect state

field.name: LOCK
field.description: Lock bit of allow restart setting, once locked, lock bit itself and configuration register will keep value until next reset 0: not locked, register can be modified 1: register locked, write access to the register is ignored

field.name: ALLOW_RESTART
field.description: allow secure state restart from fail state 0: restart is not allowed, only hardware reset can recover secure state 1: software is allowed to switch to inspect state from fail state

field.name: LOCK_NSC
field.description: Lock bit non-secure violation setting, once locked, lock bit itself and configuration will keep value until next reset 0: not locked, configuration can be modified 1: register locked, write access to the configuration is ignored

field.name: NSC_VIO_CFG
field.description: configuration of non-secure state violations, each bit represents one security event 0: event is not a security violation 1: event is a security violation

field.name: LOCK_SEC
field.description: Lock bit secure violation setting, once locked, lock bit itself and configuration will keep value until next reset 0: not locked, configuration can be modified 1: register locked, write access to the configuration is ignored

field.name: SEC_VIO_CFG
field.description: configuration of secure state violations, each bit represents one security event 0: event is not a security violation 1: event is a security violation

field.name: LOCK_NSC
field.description: Lock bit non-secure escalate setting, once locked, lock bit itself and configuration will keep value until next reset 0: not locked, configuration can be modified 1: register locked, write access to the configuration is ignored

field.name: NSC_VIO_CFG
field.description: configuration of non-secure state escalates, each bit represents one security event 0: event is not a security escalate 1: event is a security escalate

field.name: LOCK_SEC
field.description: Lock bit secure escalate setting, once locked, lock bit itself and configuration will keep value until next reset 0: not locked, configuration can be modified 1: register locked, write access to the configuration is ignored

field.name: SEC_VIO_CFG
field.description: configuration of secure state escalates, each bit represents one security event 0: event is not a security escalate 1: event is a security escalate

field.name: EVENT
field.description: local event statue, each bit represents one security event

field.name: PMIC_ESC_NSC
field.description: PMIC is escalating non-secure event

field.name: PMIC_ESC_SEC
field.description: PMIC is escalting secure event

field.name: LIFECYCLE
field.description: lifecycle status, bit7: lifecycle_debate, bit6: lifecycle_scribe, bit5: lifecycle_no_ret, bit4: lifecycle_return, bit3: lifecycle_secure, bit2: lifecycle_nonsec, bit1: lifecycle_create, bit0: lifecycle_unknow

field.name: ACTIVE
field.description: select glitch works in active mode or passve mode. 0: passive mode, depends on power glitch destroy DFF value 1: active mode, check glitch by DFF chain

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: enable glitch detector 0: detector disabled 1: detector enabled

field.name: FLAG
field.description: flag for glitch detected, write 1 to clear this flag 0: glitch not detected 1: glitch detected

field.name: FLAG
field.description: interrupt flag, each bit represents for one monitor, write 1 to clear interrupt flag 0: no monitor interrupt 1: monitor interrupt happened

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: interrupt enable, each bit represents for one monitor 0: monitor interrupt disabled 1: monitor interrupt enabled

field.name: SFTRST
field.description: Soft Reset, Perform a software reset of the RNG This bit is self-clearing. 0 Do not perform a software reset. 1 Software reset

field.name: CLRERR
field.description: Clear the Error, clear the errors in the ESR register and the RNG interrupt. This bit is self-clearing. 0 Do not clear the errors and the interrupt. 1 Clear the errors and the interrupt.

field.name: CLRINT
field.description: Clear the Interrupt, clear the RNG interrupt if an error is not present. This bit is self-clearing. 0 Do not clear the interrupt. 1 Clear the interrupt

field.name: GENSD
field.description: Generate Seed, when both ST and GS triggered, ST first and GS next.

field.name: SLFCHK
field.description: Self Test, when both ST and GS triggered, ST first and GS next.

field.name: MIRQERR
field.description: Mask Interrupt Request for Error

field.name: MIRQDN
field.description: Mask Interrupt Request for Done Event, asks the interrupts generated upon the completion of the seed and self-test modes. The status of these jobs can be viewed by: • Reading the STA and viewing the seed done and the self-test done bits (STA[SDN, STDN]). • Viewing the RNG_CMD for the generate-seed or the self-test bits (CMD[GS,ST]) being set, indicating that the operation is still taking place.

field.name: AUTRSD
field.description: Auto Reseed

field.name: FUFMOD
field.description: FIFO underflow response mode 00 Return all zeros and set the ESR[FUFE]. 01 Return all zeros and set the ESR[FUFE]. 10 Generate the bus transfer error 11 Generate the interrupt and return all zeros (overrides the CTRL[MASKERR]).

field.name: SCPF
field.description: Self Check Pass Fail

field.name: FUNCERR
field.description: Error was detected, check ESR register for details

field.name: FSIZE
field.description: Fifo Size, it is 5 in this design.

field.name: FRNNU
field.description: Fifo Level, Indicates the number of random words currently in the output FIFO

field.name: NSDDN
field.description: New seed done.

field.name: FSDDN
field.description: 1st Seed done When "1", Indicates that the RNG generated the first seed.

field.name: SCDN
field.description: Self Check Done Indicates whether Self Test is done or not. Can be cleared by the hardware reset or a new self test is initiated by setting the CMD[ST]. 0 Self test not completed 1 Completed a self test since the last reset.

field.name: RSDREQ
field.description: Reseed needed Indicates that the RNG needs to be reseeded. This is done by setting the CMD[GS], or automatically if the CTRL[ARS] is set.

field.name: IDLE
field.description: Idle, the RNG is in the idle mode, and internal clocks are disabled, in this mode, access to the FIFO is allowed. Once the FIFO is empty, the RNGB fills the FIFO and then enters idle mode again.

field.name: BUSY
field.description: when 1, means the RNG engine is busy for seeding or random number generation, self test and so on.

field.name: FUFE
field.description: FIFO access error(underflow)

field.name: SCKERR
field.description: Self-test error Indicates that the RNG failed the most recent self test. This bit is sticky and can only be reset by a hardware reset or by writing 1 to the CMD[CE]

field.name: FO2B
field.description: SW read the FIFO output.

field.name: FO2S0
field.description: FIFO out to KMAN, will be SDP engine key.

field.name: SHADOW
field.description: shadow register of fuse for pmic area for PMIC, index valid for 0-15, for SOC index valid for 16-128

field.name: LOCK
field.description: lock for pmic part shadow registers, 2 bits per 32 bit word, lock behavior is different between different fuse types 00: not locked 01: soft locked 10: not locked, and cannot lock in furture 11: double locked

field.name: FUSE
field.description: fuse array, valid in PMIC part only read operation will read out value in fuse array write operation will update fuse array value(please make sure fuse is unlocked and 2.5V power is ready)

field.name: LOCK
field.description: lock for fuse array, 2 bits per 32 bit word, lock behavior is different between different fuse types 00: not locked 01: soft locked 10: not locked, and cannot lock in furture 11: double locked

field.name: UNLOCK
field.description: unlock word for fuse array operation write "OPEN" to unlock fuse array, write any other value will lock write to fuse. Please make sure 24M crystal is running and 2.5V LDO working properly

field.name: DATA
field.description: data register for non-blocking access this register hold dat read from fuse array or data to by programmed to fuse array

field.name: ADDR
field.description: word address to be read or write

field.name: CMD
field.description: command to access fure array "BLOW" will update fuse word at ADDR to value hold in DATA "READ" will fetch fuse value in at ADDR to DATA register

field.name: REQUEST
field.description: reload request for 4 regions bit0: region0 bit1: region1 bit2: region2 bit3: region3

field.name: COMPLETE
field.description: reload complete sign for 4 regions bit0: region 0 bit1: region1 bit2: region2 bit3: region3

field.name: STOP
field.description: stop address of load region, fuse word at end address will NOT be reloaded region0: fixed at 8 region1: fixed at 16 region2: fixed at 0, region3: usrer configurable

field.name: START
field.description: start address of load region, fuse word at start address will be reloaded region0: fixed at 0 region1: fixed at 8 region2: fixed at 16, region3: usrer configurable

field.name: WRITE
field.description: fuse write flag, write 1 to clear 0: fuse is not written or writing 1: value in DATA register is programmed into fuse

field.name: READ
field.description: fuse read flag, write 1 to clear 0: fuse is not read or reading 1: fuse value is put in DATA register

field.name: LOAD
field.description: fuse load flag, write 1 to clear 0: fuse is not loaded or loading 1: fuse loaded

field.name: WRITE
field.description: fuse write interrupt enable 0: fuse write interrupt is not enable 1: fuse write interrupt is enable

field.name: READ
field.description: fuse read interrupt enable 0: fuse read interrupt is not enable 1: fuse read interrupt is enable

field.name: LOAD
field.description: fuse load interrupt enable 0: fuse load interrupt is not enable 1: fuse load interrupt is enable

field.name: KEY
field.description: software symmetric key key will be scambled to 4 variants for software to use, and replicable on same chip. scramble keys are chip different, and not replicable on different chip must be write sequencely from 0 - 7, otherwise key value will be treated as all 0

field.name: KEY
field.description: software asymmetric key key is derived from scrambles of fuse private key, software input key, SRK, and system security status. This key os read once, sencondary read will read out 0

field.name: LOCK_SEC_CTL
field.description: block secure state key setting being changed

field.name: SK_VAL
field.description: session key valid 0: session key is all 0's and not usable 1: session key is valid

field.name: SMK_SEL
field.description: software symmetric key selection 0: use origin value in software symmetric key 1: use scramble version of software symmetric key

field.name: ZMK_SEL
field.description: batt symmetric key selection 0: use scramble version of software symmetric key 1: use origin value in software symmetric key

field.name: FMK_SEL
field.description: fuse symmetric key selection 0: use scramble version of fuse symmetric key 1: use alnertave scramble of fuse symmetric key

field.name: KEY_SEL
field.description: secure symmtric key synthesize setting, key is a XOR of following bit0: fuse mk, 0: not selected, 1:selected bit1: zmk from batt, 0: not selected, 1:selected bit2: software key 0: not selected, 1:selected

field.name: LOCK_NSC_CTL
field.description: block non-secure state key setting being changed

field.name: SK_VAL
field.description: session key valid 0: session key is all 0's and not usable 1: session key is valid

field.name: SMK_SEL
field.description: software symmetric key selection 0: use scramble version of software symmetric key 1: use origin value in software symmetric key

field.name: ZMK_SEL
field.description: batt symmetric key selection 0: use scramble version of software symmetric key 1: use origin value in software symmetric key

field.name: FMK_SEL
field.description: fuse symmetric key selection 0: use scramble version of fuse symmetric key 1: use origin value in fuse symmetric key

field.name: KEY_SEL
field.description: non-secure symmtric key synthesize setting, key is a XOR of following bit0: fuse mk, 0: not selected, 1:selected bit1: zmk from batt, 0: not selected, 1:selected bit2: software key 0: not selected, 1:selected

field.name: BLOCK_RNG_XOR
field.description: block RNG_XOR bit from changing, if this bit is written to 1, it will hold 1 until next reset 0: RNG_XOR can be changed by software 1: RNG_XOR ignore software change from software

field.name: RNG_XOR
field.description: control how SFK is accepted from random number generator 0: SFK value replaced by random number input 1: SFK value exclusive or with random number input,this help generate random number using 2 rings inside RNG

field.name: BLOCK_PK_READ
field.description: asymmetric key readout control, if this bit is written to 1, it will hold 1 until next reset 0: key can be read out 1: key cannot be read out

field.name: BLOCK_SMK_READ
field.description: symmetric key readout control, if this bit is written to 1, it will hold 1 until next reset 0: key can be read out 1: key cannot be read out

field.name: TRIG_LEN
field.description: length for current trigger, can up to 4 conversions for one trigger, from 0 to 3

field.name: INTEN3
field.description: interrupt enable for 4th conversion

field.name: CHAN3
field.description: channel number for 4th conversion

field.name: INTEN2
field.description: interrupt enable for 3rd conversion

field.name: CHAN2
field.description: channel number for 3rd conversion

field.name: INTEN1
field.description: interrupt enable for 2nd conversion

field.name: CHAN1
field.description: channel number for 2nd conversion

field.name: QUEUE_EN
field.description: preemption queue enable control

field.name: INTEN0
field.description: interrupt enable for 1st conversion

field.name: CHAN0
field.description: channel number for 1st conversion

field.name: TRG_DMA_ADDR
field.description: buffer start address for trigger queue, 192byte total, 16 bytes for each trigger (4 bytes for each conversion)

field.name: TRG_SW_STA
field.description: SW trigger start bit, HW will clear it after all conversions(up to 4) finished. SW should make sure it's 0 before set it.

field.name: TRIG_SW_INDEX
field.description: which trigger for the SW trigger 0 for trig0a, 1 for trig0b… 3 for trig1a, …11 for trig3c

field.name: VALID
field.description: set after conversion finished if wait_dis is set, cleared after software read. The first time read with 0 will trigger one new conversion. If SW read other channel when one channel conversion is in progress, it will not trigger new conversion at other channel, and will get old result with valid 0, also with read_cflct interrupt status bit set. the result may not realtime if software read once and wait long time to read again

field.name: CHAN_RESULT
field.description: read this register will trigger one adc conversion. If wait_dis bit is set, SW will get the latest conversion result(not current one) with valid bit is 0, SW need polling valid bit till it's set to get current result If wait_dis bit is 0, SW can get the current conversion result with holding the bus, valid bit is always set at this mode. this is not recommended if channel sample time is too long

field.name: BUS_MODE_EN
field.description: bus mode enable

field.name: WAIT_DIS
field.description: set to disable read waiting, get result immediately but maybe not current conversion result.

field.name: CYCLE
field.description: current dma write cycle bit

field.name: SEQ_LEN
field.description: sequence queue length, 0 for one, 0xF for 16

field.name: RESTART_EN
field.description: if set together with cont_en, HW will continue process the whole queue after trigger once. If cont_en is 0, this bit is not used

field.name: CONT_EN
field.description: if set, HW will continue process the queue till end(seq_len) after trigger once

field.name: SW_TRIG
field.description: SW trigger, pulse signal, cleared by HW one cycle later

field.name: SW_TRIG_EN
field.description: set to enable SW trigger

field.name: HW_TRIG_EN
field.description: set to enable external HW trigger, only trigger on posedge

field.name: TAR_ADDR
field.description: dma target address, should be 4-byte aligned

field.name: SEQ_WR_POINTER
field.description: HW update this field after each dma write, it indicate the next dma write pointer. dma write address is (tar_addr+seq_wr_pointer)*4

field.name: STOP_POS
field.description: if stop_en is set, SW is responsible to update this field to the next read point, HW should not write data to this point since it's not read out by SW yet

field.name: DMA_RST
field.description: set this bit will reset HW dma write pointer to seq_dma_addr, and set HW cycle bit to 1. dma is halted if this bit is set. SW should clear all cycle bit in buffer to 0 before clear dma_rst

field.name: STOP_EN
field.description: set to stop dma if reach the stop_pos

field.name: BUF_LEN
SEQ_INT_EN
field.description: interrupt enable for current conversion

field.name: CHAN_NUM_4_0
field.description: channel number for current conversion

field.name: STOP_POS_HIGH
field.description: No description available

field.name: BUF_LEN_HIGH
field.description: No description available

field.name: PRD
field.description: conver period, with prescale. Set to 0 means disable current channel

field.name: THSHDH
field.description: threshold high, assert interrupt(if enabled) if result exceed high or low.

field.name: THSHDL
field.description: threshold low

field.name: CHAN_RESULT
field.description: adc convert result, update after each valid conversion. it may be updated period according to config, also may be updated due to other queue convert the same channel

field.name: SAMPLE_CLOCK_NUMBER_SHIFT
field.description: shift for sample clock number

field.name: SAMPLE_CLOCK_NUMBER
field.description: sample clock number, base on clock_period, default one period

field.name: CONVERT_CLOCK_NUMBER
CLOCK_DIVIDER
field.description: clock_period, N half clock cycle per half adc cycle 0 for same adc_clk and bus_clk, 1 for 1:2, 2 for 1:3, ... 15 for 1:16 Note: set to 2 can genenerate 66.7MHz adc_clk at 200MHz bus_clk

field.name: SEL_SYNC_AHB
field.description: set to 1 will enable sync AHB bus, to get better bus performance. Adc_clk must to be set to same as bus clock at this mode

field.name: ADC_AHB_EN
field.description: set to 1 to enable ADC DMA to write data to soc memory bus, for trig queue and seq queue;

field.name: PORT3_REALTIME
field.description: set to enable trg queue stop other queues

field.name: TRIG_CMPT
field.description: interrupt for one trigger conversion complete if enabled

field.name: TRIG_SW_CFLCT
field.description: No description available

field.name: TRIG_HW_CFLCT
field.description: No description available

field.name: READ_CFLCT
field.description: read conflict interrupt, set if wait_dis is set, one conversion is in progress, SW read another channel

field.name: SEQ_SW_CFLCT
field.description: sequence queue conflict interrupt, set if HW or SW trigger received during conversion

field.name: SEQ_HW_CFLCT
field.description: No description available

field.name: SEQ_DMAABT
field.description: dma abort interrupt, set if seqence dma write pointer reachs sw read pointer if stop_en is set

field.name: SEQ_CMPT
field.description: the whole sequence complete interrupt

field.name: SEQ_CVC
field.description: one conversion complete in seq_queue if related seq_int_en is set

field.name: DMA_FIFO_FULL
field.description: DMA fifo full interrupt, user need to check clock frequency if it's set.

field.name: AHB_ERR
field.description: set if got hresp=1, generally caused by wrong trg_dma_addr or seq_dma_addr

field.name: WDOG
field.description: set if one chanel watch dog event triggered

field.name: TRIG_CMPT
field.description: interrupt for one trigger conversion complete if enabled

field.name: TRIG_SW_CFLCT
field.description: No description available

field.name: TRIG_HW_CFLCT
field.description: No description available

field.name: READ_CFLCT
field.description: read conflict interrupt, set if wait_dis is set, one conversion is in progress, SW read another channel

field.name: SEQ_SW_CFLCT
field.description: sequence queue conflict interrupt, set if HW or SW trigger received during conversion

field.name: SEQ_HW_CFLCT
field.description: No description available

field.name: SEQ_DMAABT
field.description: dma abort interrupt, set if seqence dma write pointer reachs sw read pointer if stop_en is set

field.name: SEQ_CMPT
field.description: the whole sequence complete interrupt

field.name: SEQ_CVC
field.description: one conversion complete in seq_queue if related seq_int_en is set

field.name: DMA_FIFO_FULL
field.description: DMA fifo full interrupt, user need to check clock frequency if it's set.

field.name: AHB_ERR
field.description: set if got hresp=1, generally caused by wrong trg_dma_addr or seq_dma_addr

field.name: WDOG
field.description: set if one chanel watch dog event triggered

field.name: MOTO_EN
field.description: "set to enable moto_soc and moto_valid. Should use AHB clock for adc, this bit can be used avoid async output"

field.name: ADC_CLK_ON
field.description: set to enable adc clock to analog, Software should set this bit before access to any adc16_* register. MUST set clock_period to 0 or 1 for adc16 reg access

field.name: STARTCAL
field.description: set to start the offset calibration cycle (Active H). user need to clear it after setting it.

field.name: CALON
field.description: Indicates if the ADC is in calibration mode (Active H).

field.name: PARAM_VAL
field.description: No description available

field.name: REG_EN
field.description: set to enable regulator

field.name: BANDGAP_EN
field.description: set to enable bandgap. user should set reg_en and bandgap_en before use adc16.

field.name: CAL_AVG_CFG
PREEMPT_EN
field.description: set to enable preemption feature

field.name: CONV_PARAM
field.description: conversion parameter

field.name: COV_END_CNT
field.description: used for faster conversion, user can change it to get higher convert speed(but less accuracy). should set to (21-convert_clock_number+1).

field.name: SW_DAC_DATA
field.description: dac data used in direct mode(dac_mode==2'b10)

field.name: DMA_AHB_EN
field.description: set to enable internal DMA, it will read one burst if enough space in FIFO. Should only be used in buffer mode.

field.name: SYNC_MODE
field.description: 1: sync dac clock and ahb clock. all HW trigger signals are pulse in sync mode, can get faster response; 0: async dac clock and ahb_clock all HW trigger signals should be level and should be more than one dac clock cycle, used to get accurate output frequency(which may not be divided from AHB clock)

field.name: TRIG_MODE
field.description: 0: single mode, one trigger pulse will send one 12bit data to DAC analog; 1: continual mode, if trigger signal(either or HW) is set, DAC will send data if FIFO is not empty, if trigger signal is clear, DAC will stop send data.

field.name: HW_TRIG_EN
field.description: set to use trigger signal from trigger_mux, user should config it to pulse in single mode, and level in continual mode

field.name: DAC_MODE
field.description: 00: direct mode, DAC output the fixed configured data(from sw_dac_data) 01: step mode, DAC output from start_point to end point, with configured step, can step up or step down 10: buffer mode, read data from buffer, then output to analog, internal DMA will load next burst if enough space in local FIFO; 11: trigger mode, DAC output from external trigger signals Note: Trigger mode is not supported in hpm63xx and hpm62xx families.

field.name: BUF_DATA_MODE
field.description: data structure for buffer mode, 0: each 32-bit data contains 2 points, b11:0 for first, b27:16 for second. 1: each 32-bit data contains 1 point, b11:0 for first

field.name: HBURST_CFG
field.description: DAC support following fixed burst only 000-SINGLE; 011-INCR4; 101: INCR8 others are reserved

field.name: ANA_CLK_EN
field.description: set to enable analog clock(divided by ana_div_cfg) need to be set in direct mode and trigger mode

field.name: ANA_DIV_CFG
field.description: clock divider config for ana_clk to dac analog; 00: div2 01: div4 10: div6 11: div8

field.name: DIV_CFG
field.description: step mode and buffer mode: defines how many clk_dac cycles to change data to analog, should configured to less than 1MHz data rate. Direct mode and trigger mode: defines how many clk_dac cycles to accpet the input data, dac will not accept new written data or trigger data before the clock cycles passed. should configured to less than 1MHz. Note: For direct mode and trigger mode, this config is not supported in hpm63xx and hpm62xx families.

field.name: DMA_RST1
DMA_RST0
field.description: set to reset dma read pointer to buf0_start_addr

field.name: FIFO_CLR
field.description: set to clear FIFO content(set both read/write pointer to 0)

field.name: BUF_SW_TRIG
field.description: software trigger for buffer mode, W1C in single mode. RW in continual mode

field.name: STEP_SW_TRIG3
field.description: No description available

field.name: STEP_SW_TRIG2
field.description: No description available

field.name: STEP_SW_TRIG1
field.description: No description available

field.name: STEP_SW_TRIG0
field.description: software trigger0 for step mode, W1C in single mode. RW in continual mode

field.name: ROUND_MODE
field.description: 0: stop at end point; 1: reload start point, step again

field.name: UP_DOWN
field.description: 0 for up, 1 for down

field.name: END_POINT
field.description: No description available

field.name: STEP_NUM
field.description: output data change step_num each DAC clock cycle. Ex: if step_num=3, output data sequence is 0,3,6,9 NOTE: user should make sure end_point can be reached if step_num is not 1 if step_num is 0, output data will always at start point

field.name: START_POINT
field.description: No description available

field.name: BUF_START_ADDR
field.description: buffer start address, should be 4-byte aligned AHB burst can't cross 1K-byte boundary, user should config the address/length/burst to avoid such issue.

field.name: BUF_STOP
field.description: set to stop read point at end of bufffer0

field.name: BUF1_LEN
field.description: buffer length, 1 indicate one 32bit date, 256K-byte max for one buffer

field.name: BUF0_LEN
field.description: No description available

field.name: HYST
field.description: This bitfield configure the comparator hysteresis. 00: Hysteresis level 0 01: Hysteresis level 1 10: Hysteresis level 2 11: Hysteresis level 3

field.name: DACEN
field.description: This bit enable the comparator internal DAC 0: DAC disabled 1: DAC enabled

field.name: HPMODE
field.description: This bit enable the comparator high performance mode. 0: HP mode disabled 1: HP mode enabled

field.name: CMPEN
field.description: This bit enable the comparator. 0: ACMP disabled 1: ACMP enabled

field.name: MINSEL
field.description: PIN select, from pad_ai_acmp[7:1] and dac_out

field.name: DAC_TRIG_EN
field.description: if set, the dac value is from moto system when valid if clr, use dac_cfg value

field.name: PINSEL
field.description: MIN select, from pad_ai_acmp[7:1] and dac_out

field.name: CMPOEN
field.description: This bit enable the comparator output on pad. 0: ACMP output disabled 1: ACMP output enabled

field.name: FLTBYPS
field.description: This bit bypass the comparator output digital filter. 0: The ACMP output need pass digital filter 1: The ACMP output digital filter is bypassed.

field.name: WINEN
field.description: This bit enable the comparator window mode. 0: Window mode is disabled 1: Window mode is enabled

field.name: OPOL
field.description: The output polarity control bit. 0: The ACMP output remain un-changed. 1: The ACMP output is inverted.

field.name: FLTMODE
SYNCEN
field.description: This bit enable the comparator output synchronization. 0: ACMP output not synchronized with ACMP clock. 1: ACMP output synchronized with ACMP clock.

field.name: FLTLEN
field.description: This bitfield define the ACMP output digital filter length. The unit is ACMP clock cycle.

field.name: DACCFG
field.description: 8bit DAC digital value output to analog block

field.name: FEDGF
field.description: Output falling edge flag. Write 1 to clear this flag.

field.name: REDGF
field.description: Output rising edge flag. Write 1 to clear this flag.

field.name: FEDGEN
field.description: Output falling edge flag interrupt enable bit.

field.name: REDGEN
field.description: Output rising edge flag interrupt enable bit.

field.name: FEDGEN
field.description: Output falling edge flag DMA request enable bit.

field.name: REDGEN
field.description: Output rising edge flag DMA request enable bit.

field.name: GLB_BUSY
field.description: global busy 0: no changes pending to any nodes 1: any of nodes is changing status

field.name: LOC_BUSY
field.description: local busy 0: no change is pending for current node 1: current node is changing status

field.name: MODE
field.description: resource work mode 0:auto turn on and off as system required(recommended) 1:always on 2:always off 3:reserved

field.name: LINK
field.description: denpendency on peripherals, index count from resource ahbp(0x400), each bit represents a peripheral 0: peripheral is not needed 1: periphera is needed

field.name: LINK
field.description: denpendency on peripherals, index count from resource ahbp(0x400), each bit represents a peripheral 0: no effect 1: add periphera into this group，periphera is needed

field.name: LINK
field.description: denpendency on peripherals, index count from resource ahbp(0x400), each bit represents a peripheral 0: no effect 1: delete periphera in this group，periphera is not needed

field.name: LINK
field.description: denpendency on peripherals, index count from resource ahbp(0x400), each bit represents a peripheral 0: no effect 1: toggle the result that whether periphera is needed before

field.name: LINK
field.description: Affiliate groups of cpu0, each bit represents a group bit0: cpu0 depends on group0 bit1: cpu0 depends on group1 bit2: cpu0 depends on group2 bit3: cpu0 depends on group3

field.name: LINK
field.description: Affiliate groups of cpu0，each bit represents a group 0: no effect 1: the group is assigned to CPU0

field.name: LINK
field.description: Affiliate groups of cpu0, each bit represents a group 0: no effect 1: the group is not assigned to CPU0

field.name: LINK
field.description: Affiliate groups of cpu0, each bit represents a group 0: no effect 1: toggle the result that whether the group is assigned to CPU0 before

field.name: LINK
field.description: retention setting while CPU0 enter stop mode, each bit represents a resource bit00: soc_mem is kept on while cpu0 stop bit01: soc_ctx is kept on while cpu0 stop bit02: cpu0_mem is kept on while cpu0 stop bit03: cpu0_ctx is kept on while cpu0 stop bit04: xtal_hold is kept on while cpu0 stop bit05: pll0_hold is kept on while cpu0 stop bit06: pll1_hold is kept on while cpu0 stop

field.name: LINK
field.description: retention setting while CPU0 enter stop mode, each bit represents a resource 0: no effect 1: keep

field.name: LINK
field.description: retention setting while CPU0 enter stop mode, each bit represents a resource 0: no effect 1: no keep

field.name: LINK
field.description: retention setting while CPU0 enter stop mode, each bit represents a resource 0: no effect 1: toggle the result that whether the resource is kept on while CPU0 stop before

field.name: FLAG
field.description: flag represents power cycle happened from last clear of this bit 0: power domain did not edurance power cycle since last clear of this bit 1: power domain enduranced power cycle since last clear of this bit

field.name: FLAG_WAKE
field.description: flag represents wakeup power cycle happened from last clear of this bit 0: power domain did not edurance wakeup power cycle since last clear of this bit 1: power domain enduranced wakeup power cycle since last clear of this bit

field.name: MEM_RET_N
field.description: memory info retention control signal 0: memory enter retention mode 1: memory exit retention mode

field.name: MEM_RET_P
field.description: memory info retention control signal 0: memory not enterexitretention mode 1: memory enter retention mode

field.name: LF_DISABLE
field.description: low fanout power switch disable 0: low fanout power switches are turned on 1: low fanout power switches are truned off

field.name: LF_ACK
field.description: low fanout power switch feedback 0: low fanout power switches are turned on 1: low fanout power switches are truned off

field.name: WAIT
field.description: wait time for low fan out power switch turn on, default value is 255 0: 0 clock cycle 1: 1 clock cycles . . . clock cycles count on 24MHz

field.name: WAIT
field.description: wait time for power switch turn off, default value is 15 0: 0 clock cycle 1: 1 clock cycles . . . clock cycles count on 24MHz

field.name: WAIT
field.description: wait time for memory retention mode transition, default value is 15 0: 0 clock cycle 1: 1 clock cycles . . . clock cycles count on 24MHz

field.name: FLAG
field.description: flag represents reset happened from last clear of this bit 0: domain did not edurance reset cycle since last clear of this bit 1: domain enduranced reset cycle since last clear of this bit

field.name: FLAG_WAKE
field.description: flag represents wakeup reset happened from last clear of this bit 0: domain did not edurance wakeup reset cycle since last clear of this bit 1: domain enduranced wakeup reset cycle since last clear of this bit

field.name: HOLD
field.description: perform reset and hold in reset, until ths bit cleared by software 0: reset is released for function 1: reset is assert and hold

field.name: RESET
field.description: perform reset and release imediately 0: reset is released 1 reset is asserted and will release automatically

field.name: PRE_WAIT
field.description: wait cycle numbers before assert reset 0: wait 0 cycle 1: wait 1 cycles . . . Note, clock cycle is base on 24M

field.name: RSTCLK_NUM
field.description: reset clock number(must be even number) 0: 0 cycle 1: 0 cycles 2: 2 cycles 3: 2 cycles . . . Note, clock cycle is base on 24M

field.name: POST_WAIT
field.description: time guard band for reset release 0: wait 0 cycle 1: wait 1 cycles . . . Note, clock cycle is base on 24M

field.name: COUNTER
field.description: self clear trigger counter, reset triggered when counter value is 1, write 0 will cancel reset 0: wait 0 cycle 1: wait 1 cycles . . . Note, clock cycle is base on 24M

field.name: GLB_BUSY
field.description: global busy 0: no changes pending to any clock 1: any of nodes is changing status

field.name: LOC_BUSY
field.description: local busy 0: a change is pending for current node 1: current node is changing status

field.name: PRESERVE
field.description: preserve function against global select 0: select global clock setting 1: not select global clock setting

field.description: global clock override request bit0: override to preset0 bit1: override to preset1 bit2: override to preset2 bit3: override to preset3 bit4: override to preset4 bit5: override to preset5 bit6: override to preset6 bit7: override to preset7

field.description: result is ready for read 0: not ready 1: result is ready

field.description: divider is applying new setting

field.name: OUTEN
field.description: enable clock output

field.name: DIV
field.description: output divider

field.name: HIGH
field.description: clock frequency higher than upper limit

field.name: LOW
field.description: clock frequency lower than lower limit

field.name: START
field.description: start measurement

field.name: MODE
field.description: work mode, 0: register value will be compared to measurement 1: upper and lower value will be recordered in register

field.name: ACCURACY
field.description: measurement accuracy, 0: resolution is 1kHz 1: resolution is 1Hz

field.name: REFERENCE
field.description: reference clock selection, 0: 32k 1: 24M

field.name: SELECTION
field.description: clock measurement selection

field.name: FREQUENCY
field.description: self updating measure result

field.name: FREQUENCY
field.description: lower frequency

field.name: FREQUENCY
field.description: upper frequency

field.name: WAKE_CNT
field.description: CPU0 wake up counter, counter satuated at 255, write 0x00 to clear

field.name: HALT
field.description: halt request for CPU0, 0: CPU0 will start to execute after reset or receive wakeup request 1: CPU0 will not start after reset, or wakeup after WFI

field.name: WAKE
field.description: CPU0 is waking up 0: CPU0 wake up not asserted 1: CPU0 wake up asserted

field.name: EXEC
field.description: CPU0 is executing 0: CPU0 is not executing 1: CPU0 is executing

field.name: WAKE_FLAG
field.description: CPU0 wakeup flag, indicate a wakeup event got active, write 1 to clear this bit 0: CPU0 wakeup not happened 1: CPU0 wake up happened

field.name: SLEEP_FLAG
field.description: CPU0 sleep flag, indicate a sleep event got active, write 1 to clear this bit 0: CPU0 sleep not happened 1: CPU0 sleep happened

field.name: RESET_FLAG
field.description: CPU0 reset flag, indicate a reset event got active, write 1 to clear this bit 0: CPU0 reset not happened 1: CPU0 reset happened

field.name: MODE
field.description: Low power mode, system behavior after WFI 00: CPU clock stop after WFI 01: System enter low power mode after WFI 10: Keep running after WFI 11: reserved

field.name: GPR
field.description: Lock bit for CPU_DATA0 to CPU_DATA13, once set, this bit will not clear untile next reset

field.name: LOCK
field.description: Lock bit for CPU_LOCK

field.name: GPR
field.description: register for software to handle resume, can save resume address or status

field.name: STATUS
field.description: IRQ values

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: IRQ wakeup enable

field.name: LOOP_BACK
field.description: force input on 0: disable 1: enable

field.name: ANALOG
field.description: select analog pin in pad 0: disable 1: enable

field.name: ALT_SELECT
field.description: alt select 0: ALT0 1: ALT1 ... 31:ALT31

field.name: HYS
field.description: schmitt trigger enable 0: disable 1: enable

field.name: PRS
field.description: select pull up/down internal resistance strength: For pull down, only have 100 Kohm resistance For pull up: 00: 100 KOhm 01: 47 KOhm 10: 22 KOhm 11: 22 KOhm

field.name: PS
field.description: pull select 0: pull down 1: pull up

field.name: PE
field.description: pull enable 0: pull disable 1: pull enable

field.name: KE
field.description: keeper capability enable 0: keeper disable 1: keeper enable

field.name: OD
field.description: open drain 0: open drain disable 1: open drain enable

field.name: SR
field.description: slew rate 0: Slow slew rate 1: Fast slew rate

field.name: SPD
field.description: additional 2-bit slew rate to select IO cell operation frequency range with reduced switching noise 00: Slow frequency slew rate(50Mhz) 01: Medium frequency slew rate(100 Mhz) 10: Fast frequency slew rate(150 Mhz) 11: Max frequency slew rate(200Mhz)

field.name: BUSY
field.description: Busy flag 0: Oscillator is working or shutdown 1: Oscillator is changing status

field.name: RESPONSE
field.description: Crystal oscillator status 0: Oscillator is not stable 1: Oscillator is stable for use

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: Crystal oscillator enable status 0: Oscillator is off 1: Oscillator is on

field.name: RAMP_TIME
field.description: Rampup time of XTAL oscillator in cycles of RC24M clock 0: 0 cycle 1: 1 cycle 2: 2 cycle 1048575: 1048575 cycles

field.name: BUSY
field.description: Busy flag 0: PLL is stable or shutdown 1: PLL is changing status

field.name: RESPONSE
field.description: PLL status 0: PLL is not stable 1: PLL is stable for use

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: PLL enable status 0: PLL is off 1: PLL is on

field.name: MFI
field.description: loop back divider of PLL, support from 13 to 42, f=fref*(mfi + mfn/mfd) 0-15: invalid 16: divide by 16 17: divide by17 . . . 42: divide by 42 43~:invalid

field.name: MFN
field.description: Numeratorof fractional part,f=fref*(mfi + mfn/mfd). This field supports changing while running.

field.name: MFD
field.description: Demoninator of fraction part,f=fref*(mfi + mfn/mfd). This field should not be changed during PLL enabled. If changed, change will take efftect when PLL re-enabled.

field.name: STEP
field.description: Step of spread spectrum modulator. This register should not be changed during PLL and spread spectrum enabled. If changed, new value will take effect when PLL disabled or spread spectrum disabled.

field.name: STOP
field.description: Stop point of spread spectrum modulator This register should not be changed during PLL and spread spectrum enabled. If changed, new value will take effect when PLL disabled or spread spectrum disabled.

field.name: SPREAD
field.description: Enable spread spectrum function. This field supports changing during PLL running.

field.name: REFSEL
field.description: Select reference clock, This filed support changing while running, but application must take frequency error and jitter into consideration. And if MFN changed before reference switch, application need make sure time is enough for MFN updating. 0: XTAL24M 1: IRC24M

field.name: LOCKTIME
field.description: Lock time of PLL in 24M clock cycles, typical value is 2500. If MFI changed during PLL startup, PLL lock time may be longer than this setting.

field.name: STEPTIME
field.description: Step time for MFI on-the-fly change in 24M clock cycles, typical value is 2500.

field.name: SLOW
field.description: Use slow lock flow, PLL lock expendite is disabled. This mode might be stabler. And software need config LOCKTIME field accordingly. 0: fast lock enabled, lock time is 100us 1: fast lock disabled, lock time is 400us

field.name: DITHER
field.description: Enable dither function

field.name: BUSY
field.description: Busy flag 0: divider is working 1: divider is changing status

field.name: RESPONSE
field.description: Divider response status 0: Divider is not stable 1: Divider is stable for use

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: Divider enable status 0: Divider is off 1: Divider is on

field.name: DIV
field.description: Divider factor, divider factor is DIV/5 + 1 0: divide by 1 1: divide by 1.2 2: divide by 1.4 . . . 63: divide by 13.6

field.name: FLAG
field.description: reset reason of last hard reset, write 1 to clear each bit 0: brownout 1: temperature 4: debug reset 5: jtag soft reset 8: cpu0 lockup(not available) 9: cpu1 lockup(not available) 10: cpu0 request(not available) 11: cpu1 request(not available) 16: watch dog 0 17: watch dog 1 18: watch dog 2(not available) 19: watch dog 3(not available) 24: pmic watch dog 30: jtag ieee reset 31: software

field.name: STATUS
field.description: current status of reset sources 0: brownout 1: temperature 4: debug reset 5: jtag soft reset 8: cpu0 lockup(not available) 9: cpu1 lockup(not available) 10: cpu0 request(not available) 11: cpu1 request(not available) 16: watch dog 0 17: watch dog 1 18: watch dog 2(not available) 19: watch dog 3(not available) 24: pmic watch dog 30: jtag ieee reset 31: software

field.name: HOLD
field.description: hold arrtibute, when set, SOC keep in reset status until reset source release, or, reset will be released after SOC enter reset status 0: brownout 1: temperature 4: debug reset 5: jtag soft reset 8: cpu0 lockup(not available) 9: cpu1 lockup(not available) 10: cpu0 request(not available) 11: cpu1 request(not available) 16: watch dog 0 17: watch dog 1 18: watch dog 2(not available) 19: watch dog 3(not available) 24: pmic watch dog 30: jtag ieee reset 31: software

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: enable of reset sources 0: brownout 1: temperature 4: debug reset 5: jtag soft reset 8: cpu0 lockup(not available) 9: cpu1 lockup(not available) 10: cpu0 request(not available) 11: cpu1 request(not available) 16: watch dog 0 17: watch dog 1 18: watch dog 2(not available) 19: watch dog 3(not available) 24: pmic watch dog 30: jtag ieee reset 31: software

field.name: TYPE
field.description: reset type of reset sources, 0 for cold reset, all system control setting cleared except debug/fuse/ioc; 1 for hot reset, keep system control setting and debug/fuse/ioc setting, only clear some subsystem 0: brownout 1: temperature 4: debug reset 5: jtag soft reset 8: cpu0 lockup(not available) 9: cpu1 lockup(not available) 10: cpu0 request(not available) 11: cpu1 request(not available) 16: watch dog 0 17: watch dog 1 18: watch dog 2(not available) 19: watch dog 3(not available) 24: pmic watch dog 30: jtag ieee reset 31: software

field.name: COUNTER
field.description: counter decrease in 24MHz and stop at 0, trigger reset when value reach 2, software can write 0 to cancel reset

field.name: VBG_TRIMMED
field.description: Bandgap trim happened, this bit set by hardware after trim value loaded, and stop load, write 0 will clear this bit and reload trim value 0: bandgap is not trimmed 1: bandgap is trimmed

field.name: VBG_1P0_TRIM
field.description: Banggap 1.0V output trim value

field.name: VBG_P65_TRIM
field.description: Banggap 1.0V output trim value

field.name: VBG_P50_TRIM
field.description: Banggap 1.0V output trim value

field.name: VOLT
field.description: LDO output voltage in mV, value valid through 700-1320, , step 20mV. Hardware select voltage no less than target if not on valid steps, with maximum 1320mV. 700: 700mV 720: 720mV . . . 1320:1320mV

field.name: READY
field.description: Ready flag, will set 1ms after enabled or voltage change 0: LDO is not ready for use 1: LDO is ready

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: LDO enable 0: turn off LDO 1: turn on LDO

field.name: VOLT
field.description: LDO output voltage in mV, value valid through 2125-2900, step 25mV. Hardware select voltage no less than target if not on valid steps, with maximum 2900mV. 2125: 2125mV 2150: 2150mV . . . 2900:2900mV

field.name: READY
field.description: Ready flag 0: DCDC is applying new change 1: DCDC is ready

field.name: MODE
field.description: DCDC work mode XX0: trun off 001: basic mode 011: generic mode 101: automatic mode 111: expert mode

field.name: VOLT
field.description: DCDC voltage in mV in normal mode, value valid through 600-1375, , step 25mV. Hardware select voltage no less than target if not on valid steps, with maximum 1375mV. 600: 600mV 625: 625mV . . . 1375:1375mV

field.name: STBY_VOLT
field.description: DCDC voltage in mV in standby mode, , value valid through 600-1375, , step 25mV. Hardware select voltage no less than target if not on valid steps, with maximum 1375mV. 600: 600mV 625: 625mV . . . 1375:1375mV

field.name: ILIMIT_LP
field.description: over current setting for low power mode 0:250mA 1:200mA

field.name: OVERLOAD_LP
field.description: over current in low power mode 0: current is below setting 1: overcurrent happened in low power mode

field.name: POWER_LOSS_FLAG
field.description: power loss 0: input power is good 1: input power is too low

field.name: DISABLE_OVERVOLTAGE
field.description: ouput over voltage protection 0: protection enabled, DCDC will shut down is output voltage is unexpected high 1: protection disabled, DCDC continue to adjust output voltage

field.name: OVERVOLT_FLAG
field.description: output over voltage flag 0: output is normal 1: output is unexpected high

field.name: DISABLE_SHORT
field.description: disable output short circuit protection 0: short circuits protection enabled, DCDC shut down if short circuit on ouput detected 1: short circuit protection disabled

field.name: SHORT_CURRENT
field.description: short circuit current setting 0: 2.0A, 1: 1.3A

field.name: SHORT_FLAG
field.description: short circuit flag 0: current is within limit 1: short circuits detected

field.name: ESTI_EN
field.description: enable current measure

field.name: VALID
field.description: Current level valid 0: data is invalid 1: data is valid

field.description: DCDC current level, current level is num * 50mA

field.description: enable feed forward detect 0: feed forward detect is disabled 1: feed forward detect is enabled

field.name: EN_FF_LOOP
field.description: enable feed forward loop 0: feed forward loop is disabled 1: feed forward loop is enabled

field.name: EN_AUTOLP
field.description: enable auto enter low power mode 0: do not enter low power mode 1: enter low power mode if current is detected low

field.name: EN_DCM_EXIT
field.description: avoid over voltage 0: stay in DCM mode when voltage excess 1: change to CCM mode when voltage excess

field.description: clock selection 0: select DCDC internal oscillator 1: select RC24M oscillator

field.name: EN_STEP
field.description: enable stepping in voltage change 0: stepping disabled 1: steping enabled

field.description: DCDC voltage change time in 24M clock cycles, default value is 1mS

field.name: START_TIME

field.name: RESUME_TIME

field.name: TRIGGERED
field.description: Low power trap status, thit bit will set when power related low power flow triggered, write 1 to clear this flag. 0: low power trap is not triggered 1: low power trap triggered

field.name: RETENTION
field.description: DCDC enter standby mode, which will reduce voltage for memory content retention 0: Shutdown DCDC 1: reduce DCDC voltage

field.name: TRAP
field.description: Enable trap of SOC power supply, trap is used to hold SOC in low power mode for DCDC to enter further low power mode, this bit will self-clear when power related low pwer flow triggered 0: trap not enabled, pmic side low power function disabled 1: trap enabled, STOP operation leads to PMIC low power flow if SOC is not retentioned.

field.name: CAUSE
field.description: wake up cause, each bit represents one wake up source, write 1 to clear the register bit 0: wake up source is not active during last wakeup 1: wake up source is active furing last wakeup bit 0: pmic_enable bit 7: UART interrupt bit 8: TMR interrupt bit 9: WDG interrupt bit10: GPIO in PMIC interrupt bit31: pin wakeup

field.name: MASK
field.description: mask for wake up sources, each bit represents one wakeup source 0: allow source to wake up system 1: disallow source to wakeup system bit 0: pmic_enable bit 7: UART interrupt bit 8: TMR interrupt bit 9: WDG interrupt bit10: GPIO in PMIC interrupt bit31: pin wakeup

field.name: SCG
